event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/l8/d1da81a1-ec1b-4ab4-9b8c-e2bafed45113.png)

​https://stanfordfounders.stanford.edu/

​Want to Get Involved?
We're actively welcoming speakers, sponsors, and strategic partners.

## ​Questions? Connect with the Stanford Demo Day **hosts** anytime:

​ **Talk to** **[Rohan Parekh](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.**

speaker_insight: Johnny Chang is a host at Stanford Founders, a program supporting Stanford entrepreneurs. He focuses on helping founders navigate the challenges of early-stage company building. Chang is an experienced investor and advisor. He has a background in product and business strategy. His work is centered on providing resources and mentorship to aspiring entrepreneurs within the Stanford community.

event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

## ​ **🌐 More info about us:**

​https://stanfordfounders.stanford.edu/

​Want to Get Involved?
We're actively welcoming speakers, sponsors, and strategic partners.

## ​Questions? Connect with the Stanford Demo Day **hosts** anytime:

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ye/b742d388-197c-4418-b4ac-33a76ea43f51.png)

​ **Connect with** **[Johnny Chang](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **to discuss collaboration with Stanford Founders.**

​ **Talk to** **[Sophie Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/)** **about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships.**

speaker_insight: Francesco Marchioni is currently a host at Stanford Founders. He focuses on providing valuable insights and facilitating connections within the entrepreneurial community at Stanford. Previously, he worked at Accurat, a data visualization and design innovation company. His experience includes product design and development roles. He has a background in computational science and engineering. He attended Politecnico di Milano and Stanford University.

event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

​https://stanfordfounders.stanford.edu/

​Want to Get Involved?
We're actively welcoming speakers, sponsors, and strategic partners.

## ​Questions? Connect with the Stanford Demo Day **hosts** anytime:

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ye/b742d388-197c-4418-b4ac-33a76ea43f51.png)

​ **Connect with** **[Johnny Chang](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **to discuss collaboration with Stanford Founders.**

​ **Talk to** **[Sophie Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/)** **about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships.**

​ **Learn from** **[Chris Bradbury](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support.**

​ **Get expert insights from** **[Francesco Marchioni](https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/)** **on Aero & Defense industry participation.**

​ **Talk to** **[Rohan Parekh](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.**

speaker_insight: Rohan Parekh is a host at Stanford Founders, focused on fostering entrepreneurship and innovation. He studied Computer Science at Stanford University, graduating in 2015. Previously, he worked at Branch and as a Software Engineer at Facebook. He is also the co-founder of the AI-powered platform, TheBrowserCo. His expertise lies in software engineering, product development, and the startup ecosystem.

event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

speaker_insight:
**

Chris Bradbury is the host of Stanford Founders, a program within the Stanford ecosystem. He works with and interviews founders. He has experience within Stanford's entrepreneurial programs. His focus is on supporting and amplifying the stories of individuals building companies and innovations. He is connected to the broader Stanford community.

event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/l8/d1da81a1-ec1b-4ab4-9b8c-e2bafed45113.png)

## ​ **🌐 More info about us:**

​https://stanfordfounders.stanford.edu/

​Want to Get Involved?
We're actively welcoming speakers, sponsors, and strategic partners.

## ​Questions? Connect with the Stanford Demo Day **hosts** anytime:

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ye/b742d388-197c-4418-b4ac-33a76ea43f51.png)

​ **Connect with** **[Johnny Chang](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **to discuss collaboration with Stanford Founders.**

​ **Talk to** **[Sophie Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/)** **about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships.**

speaker_insight: Sophie Raucoules is currently a host at Stanford Founders, supporting early-stage startups in the Stanford community. She is also an investor at the Dorm Room Fund. Previously, she worked as a consultant at Bain & Company. Sophie graduated from Stanford University. She focuses on providing resources and guidance to help founders succeed.

event_name: Stanford Founders Demo Day | Spring 2025
event_summary: The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.
speaker_details: Connect with Johnny Chang to discuss the Stanford founder network and team dynamics. Talk to Sophie Ren about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships. Learn from Chris Bradbury about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support. Get expert insights from Francesco Marchioni on Aero & Defense industry participation. Talk to Rohan Parekh about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.

## ​ **🌟 Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 🌟**

​📅 May 29, 2025 \| Time: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM \| 1 DAY
📍 Tresidder Memorial Union, 459 Lagunita Drive, Stanford, CA 94305.
**🚀100+ Startups \| 100+ VCs \| 600+ Attendees**

​The Stanford Founders Demo Day – Spring 2025 is a premier gathering designed to foster innovation, showcase talent, and ignite meaningful connections within the Stanford entrepreneurial ecosystem.

## ​Join us for a dynamic day filled with:

​ 🎤 Visionary keynote speakers

​🚀 High-signal startup pitches

​🤝 Real-time networking and collaboration opportunities

## ​ **The event is your front-row seat to:**

​Discover the groundbreaking ideas shaping the future
Meet Stanford-affiliated founders building across AI, consumer tech, health, B2B SaaS, climate, and more
Connect with investors, operators, and fellow builders who are driving change

## ​ **Who Should Join?**

​ 🔹 Founders (Stanford-Affiliated) Actively building, raising, or hiring? Apply to pitch your startup! ⏳ Applications accepted on a rolling basis (Deadline: May 15) 👉 [https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9](https://forms.gle/vLcRaXdomUyyoAAm9)

​🔹 Investors
Ready to discover the next breakout startup? Get access to the pitch list and investor-only updates.
👉 https://forms.gle/LvakkkB9n4YYBcbo7

​🔹 Observers (Students, Alumni, Operators)
RSVP on Luma to attend as a guest and get all the updates:
👉 https://lu.ma/stanfordfounders

## ​ **🌐 More info about us:**

​https://stanfordfounders.stanford.edu/

​Want to Get Involved?
We're actively welcoming speakers, sponsors, and strategic partners.

## ​Questions? Connect with the Stanford Demo Day **hosts** anytime:

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ye/b742d388-197c-4418-b4ac-33a76ea43f51.png)

​ **Connect with** **[Johnny Chang](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **to discuss collaboration with Stanford Founders.**

​ **Talk to** **[Sophie Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/)** **about venture ecosystems, strategic investments, and building powerful partnerships.**

​ **Learn from** **[Chris Bradbury](http://xn--johnny%20chang:%20[stanford%20founders%20&%20our%20team]%20%20connect%20with%20johnny%20to%20discuss%20the%20stanford%20founder%20network%20and%20team%20dynamics-p828h.%20https//www.linkedin.com/in/johnnychang4/%20%20Sophie%20Ren:%20[Investment%20&%20Partnerships]%20%E2%80%93%20%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophie-r-60981b9b/%20Talk%20to%20Sophie%20about%20venture%20ecosystems,%20strategic%20investments,%20and%20building%20powerful%20partnerships.%20%20Chris%20Bradbury:%20[Startup%20Engagement]%20%E2%80%93%20%20Learn%20from%20Chris%20about%20startup%20participation,%20scaling%20strategies,%20and%20founder%20support.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/chris-bradbury-0bb239108/%20Francesco%20Marchioni:%20[Aerospace%20&%20Defense]%20%E2%80%93%20Get%20expert%20insights%20from%20Francesco%20on%20Aero%20&%20Defense%20industry%20participation.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/%20%20Rohan%20Parekh:%20[Energy%20&%20Sustainability]%20%E2%80%93%20Talk%20to%20Rohan%20about%20industry%20trends,%20innovations,%20and%20opportunities%20in%20energy%20and%20sustainability.%20https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **about startup participation, scaling strategies, and founder support.**

​ **Get expert insights from** **[Francesco Marchioni](https://www.linkedin.com/in/fmprof/)** **on Aero & Defense industry participation.**

​ **Talk to** **[Rohan Parekh](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rohan-parekh-5b54751ab/)** **about industry trends, innovations, and opportunities in energy and sustainability.**

speaker_insight: Trishia El Chemaly is the Host of Stanford Founders. She works at Stanford University. She focuses on building community for founders and enabling valuable conversations. She also explores the intersection of entrepreneurship and the human experience. Her experience includes working with startups and understanding the founder journey.

event_name: Vibe Coding for Designers
event_summary: Pizza. Beers. And watching your product ideas come to life in real-time. No engineers required. The Emergent team is hosting a small, invite-only hangout in SF for enthusiastic Product Designers, where you'll witness something kind of magical: Designers like you describing products in plain English and watching them materialize into working, full-stack applications. Not mockups. Not prototypes. Real, shippable products.
host_name: Emergent Team, Gaurav S. Bisen & Madhav Jha
speaker_details: Not specified
speaker_insight: Gaurav S. Bisen is a technology leader. Based on his LinkedIn profile, he works at Microsoft as a Principal Program Manager Lead. His experience includes product management and program management roles within the tech industry. He seems to focus on AI and machine learning. He has a background in computer science.

event_name: Vibe Coding for Designers
event_summary: Pizza. Beers. And watching your product ideas come to life in real-time. No engineers required. host_name: Emergent Team, Gaurav S. Bisen & Madhav Jha
speaker_details: Not specified
speaker_insight:
**
Madhav Jha is a product manager based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He is currently working at Google as a product manager. Previously he worked at VMware as a product manager. He holds a Master's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University and a Bachelor's Degree from the Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati. His experience spans product development and technical roles.

event_name: 📚 Short Story Symposium [public]
event_summary: I'm interested in having some laid-back yet stimulating conversations about some of my favorite pieces of short fiction. A general aim of the stories will be to explore alternative possible worlds through fiction with the hope of gaining more insight into our own. To that end, many of the short stories will include an element of futurism, speculation, and social commentary. We’ll feature authors like Ted Chiang, Ursula K Le Guin, Greg Egan, and others.

# 📚 Short Story Symposium \[public\]

Hosted by Mendel Liu & The SF Commons

May

28

Wednesday, May 28

6:30 PM - 7:30 PM PDT

[550 Laguna St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=550%20Laguna%20St&query_place_id=ChIJQ9xlT6KAhYAReQIfVQZP4ds)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Note: while there are many guests listed in the RSVP, most of these are carried over from previous events in this series. We don't expect much more than 30 to attend.

I'm interested in having some laid-back yet stimulating conversations about some of my favorite pieces of short fiction.

​A general aim of the stories will be to explore alternative possible worlds through fiction with the hope of gaining more insight into our own. To that end, many of the short stories will include an element of futurism, speculation, and social commentary. We’ll feature authors like Ted Chiang, Ursula K Le Guin, Greg Egan, and others.

Readings for 2025:

- ​January 22: _The Manamouki_, by Mike Resnick ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IrDpZy_44FNsmpIFy6CFiBxDKOZFYDG7/view?usp=drive_link))

  - ​Sequel to _Kirinyaga_, recommended but not required( [Read](https://www.baen.com/Chapters/034541702X/034541702X___1.htm))
- ​February 5: _Story of Your Life_, by Ted Chiang [(Read](https://raley.english.ucsb.edu/wp-content/uploads/Reading/Chiang-story.pdf) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7K74v56MU8&t=12344s))

- ​February 19: _Houston, Houston, Do You Read_, by James Tiptree Jr ( [Read](https://www.sfsfss.com/stories/HoustonHouston.html))

- ​March 12: _The People of Sand and Slag_, by Paolo Bacigalupi ( [Read](https://windupstories.com/books/pump-six-and-other-stories/people-of-sand-and-slag/))

- ​April 2: _A Word for Heathens_, by Peter Watts ( [Read](https://rifters.com/real/shorts/PeterWatts_Heathens.pdf))

- ​April 23: _A Little Knowledge_, by Mike Resnick ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rMIfMicmiI04aFAzOK9kNsFLI4Mq-sc7/view?usp=drive_link))

  - ​Sequel to _The Manamouki_, recommended but not required ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IrDpZy_44FNsmpIFy6CFiBxDKOZFYDG7/view?usp=drive_link))
- ​May 28: _Black Mirror - San Junipero_ ( [Watch](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M7IogtugYBix4FUUVsnkW0mJCIi-mZq5/view?usp=drive_link))


​Readings for 2024:

- ​January 24: _The Ones Who Walk Away From Omelas_, by Ursula K Le Guin ( [Read](https://shsdavisapes.pbworks.com/f/Omelas.pdf))

- ​February 7: _Liking What You See: A Documentary_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://www.are.na/block/8515263) / [Listen](https://youtu.be/Q7K74v56MU8?t=31731))

- ​February 21: _Learning to be Me_, by Greg Egan ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xbpHrbm4e2vbaj4WTwGPea_G1NXgKiD8/view?usp=share_link))

- ​March 6: _Exhalation_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://www.lightspeedmagazine.com/fiction/exhalation/) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mNbfU2gAnXE))

- ​March 20: _Nine Lives_, by Ursula K Le Guin ( [Read](http://www.baen.com/Chapters/9781625791405/9781625791405___2.htm))

- ​April 3: _The Merchant and The Alchemist's Gate_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://www.are.na/block/4550302) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9VYXqBW4ink))

- ​April 17: _Bloodchild_, by Octavia Butler ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IPRE6zIE7btsUzjwWsN4DL2h15XeMfiZ/view?usp=share_link))

- ​May 15: _Omphalos_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_F438WQLHuDvCASaIfe4k_WpAa9HdBx8/view?usp=share_link))

- ​June 5: _Chrysalis_, by Mary Robinette Kowal ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fbOJ-H9ffy0UjvNAZWwyJu_3ne8JQE2q/view?usp=share_link))

- ​June 19: _Kirinyaga_, by Mike Resnick ( [Read](https://www.baen.com/Chapters/034541702X/034541702X___1.htm))

- ​July 17: _Anxiety is the Dizziness of Freedom_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SMRRl6O83DLc_blvW6qUt0gZk4lBVwJD/view))

- ​July 31: _Reasons to be Cheerful_, by Greg Egan ( [Read](https://www.utilitarianism.com/greg-egan/Reasons-To-Be-Cheerful.pdf))

- ​August 14: _Tower of Babylon_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://jenniecreatesclasses.files.wordpress.com/2021/03/tower_of_babylon_-_ted_chiang.pdf) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7K74v56MU8))

- ​August 28: _Kingsmeat_, by Orson Scott Card ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mgg1Zjw6Kht7bArKZCtvx6_m86qOR4lB/view?usp=drive_link))

- ​September 11: _Zima Blue_, by Alastair Reynolds ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QQNNWHw6DB5-bKgZJFxezcW3b0TSPxO9/view?usp=drive_link) / [Watch](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QMrL4v0hzuQIK6AVaA6UxsgZLN3nLD_j/view?usp=drive_link))

- ​September 25: _The Truth of Fact, the Truth of Feeling_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZQoHLknbj8kcTdcMEvFnazu73YIBKO_g/view))

- ​October 9: _Psycho Pass,_( [Watch Ep. 1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ML-iqXrCS0A), [Watch Ep. 2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nl4yNrI-Y8Q))

- ​October 23: _For I have Touched the Sky_, by Mike Resnick ( [Read](https://www.baen.com/Chapters/034541702X/034541702X___2.htm))

  - ​Sequel to _Kirinyaga_, recommended but not required( [Read](https://www.baen.com/Chapters/034541702X/034541702X___1.htm))
- ​November 6: _Flowers for Algernon_, by Daniel Keyes ( [Read](https://www.sdfo.org/gj/stories/flowersforalgernon.pdf) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FDfE0NaAfgg&list=PLeZZJJMLW02Vs_u9VWxwDt2SxcPwXmU_F&index=1))

- ​November 20: _The Consciousness Problem_, by Mary Robinette Kowal ( [Read](https://www.lightspeedmagazine.com/fiction/the-consciousness-problem/))

- ​December 11: _Hell is the Absence of God_, by Ted Chiang ( [Read](https://www.are.na/block/2764145) / [Listen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7K74v56MU8&t=27357s))


​We'll post links to each story well in advance of each meeting. You're strongly encouraged to read the stories ahead of time and bring any thoughts you'd like to discuss! Contact me by text if you're having trouble finding the location.

If you enjoy this event, you might also be interested in having similar discussions here: [https://lu.ma/thoughtexperiments](https://lu.ma/thoughtexperiments)

About Event

​ **Hey Founders, Investors & Tech Professionals! 🌭🏐**

​ **With May closing out the spring season, we’re throwing a Volleyball + Fresh-Off-the-Grill BBQ picnic at the beautiful Golden Gate Park! 🏞** Let’s soak in the spring sunshine one last time before summer kicks in.

* * *

​ **What’s Included?**

✅ BBQ off the grill – Classic American-style burgers & hotdogs (including vegan options)

✅ Fresh juice and snacks

✅ Volleyball setup – mostly friendly and casual games (come in even if you haven't tried before)

✅ A few cup games to spark some friendly competition

✅ Chill music and a lot of laid back conversations

**Other Details:**

🍺 BYOB – Beer & Wine only (no glass bottles or liquor per park rules)

🍱 Feel free to bring a favorite snack or dish to share (optional)

🚻 Restrooms are available near Hellman Hollow

👥 Capped at 20 people to keep things intimate and friendly

​We’ve already booked Table 6 at Marx Event Meadow with the park authority, so bring yourself and maybe a little bit of sunscreen, excited to see you all!☀️

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

About Event

​What’s new in Voice? A lot. LLMs are transforming the Voice AI space - and fast, too! Join us on May 28 at Vapi HQ in SF for an evening of cutting-edge tech talks, tasty snacks & drinks, and great conversations about the future of the web and Voice AI. Don’t miss it!

# ​​Talks

- ​ **Building a voice-first future**

_Elizabeth Trykin, DX at Vapi_


# ​​​Schedule

- ​​​ **5:00 – 6:00 PM**: Doors open! Grab a snack, enjoy a drink, and meet fellow attendees.

- ​​​ **6:00 – 7:00 PM**: Time for tech talks!

- ​​​ **7:00 – 8:00 PM**: Stick around to chat, connect, and dive deeper into all things web discussions.​


# ​About Vapi

​This event is hosted by our friends at Vapi. Vapi is a developer platform for building, testing, and deploying voice AI agents. It provides the infrastructure for businesses and developers to create custom voice assistants that can handle call operations for existing customer support, appointment booking, and sales calls, or for building new products using voice AI like prior authorization and product onboarding assistants. Try Vapi at [vapi.ai](https://vapi.ai/).

# ​​​About All Things Web​​​​

​​​We are a group of web enthusiasts who love to bring the community together and chat about all things web! Subscribe to [our Luma calendar](https://lu.ma/allthingsweb) for upcoming events, visit [allthingsweb.dev](http://allthingsweb.dev/) to learn more, and [join our Discord](https://discord.gg/B3Sm4b5mfD) server to stay connected.

# Saving the Planet, One Burp-Free Cow at a Time

Hosted by Big Brain SF

May

28

Wednesday, May 28

7:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[663 Haight St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=663%20Haight%20St&query_place_id=ChIJu1i3Z6aAhYARHGDc7ZI77hw)

Ticket Price

$25.00

Per ticket

Tickets

1

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

Have an access code? You can enter it here.

About Event

​🌍 **What if the key to fighting climate change starts with stopping cows from burping methane?**

​Join us at The Wave as we host **Alex Brown**, cofounder and CEO of **Alga Biosciences**, a startup tackling a major contributor to climate change: methane emissions from cows. By preventing this potent greenhouse gas at the source, Alga is rethinking what climate solutions can look like.

​In this talk, we’ll explore the bigger picture:

– What’s the right _order of operations_ for tackling the climate crisis?

– Can we _depoliticize_ climate change?

– What role should _capitalism_ play in solving it?

– And how do we balance _evolution_ vs. _revolution_ in industry?

​The answers may not be clear-cut, but this conversation will spark new ideas, challenge old assumptions, and leave us all with a little more hope about the future. 🌱

# ​❓FAQs❓

## ​​​What should I expect?

​​​7:00-7:40 --> arrival & chats

​​​7:40-8:20 --> lecture

​​​8:20-9:00 --> q&a and more chatting

## ​​​ **Who's invited?**

​​​Anyone with an interest in learning new things, meeting new people, and doing fun things on weeknights! Lots of people came solo to our last event, so don't be afraid to do the same—you’ll meet some awesome people!

## ​​​ **What about parking?**

​​​There's no parking on-site, so we recommend street parking or using public transportation.

## ​ **Do I have to be 21+?**

​No :) This venue is open to all ages.

## ​​​ **What about refunds?**

​You can refund your ticket up to 24 hours before the event starts. Since this is a limited-space event, we encourage you to update your RSVP if you can’t make it—this helps us keep spots open for others.

## ​​​ **I can't make it to this event. How do I stay updated for future events?**

​​Join our email list! [https://forms.gle/GQdDjd2UTV48F5Z17](https://forms.gle/GQdDjd2UTV48F5Z17)

​​​Follow our Instagram! [https://www.instagram.com/bigbrainsf/](https://www.instagram.com/bigbrainsf/)

## ​​​How do I become a speaker?

​​​Email _bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com_ with your name, a brief description of who you are, and what you're passionate about / researching.

## ​​About Our Ticket Structure

​We’re not taking a profit—every ticket sold goes directly back into the business. Our pricing also depends on the venue, and this space charges us a rental fee, which is why tickets for this event are slightly higher than previous ones.

​That said, we’re committed to making our events accessible to everyone. If cost is a barrier, please don’t hesitate to reach out by emailing us at **bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com**—we reserve a handful of tickets for financial assistance at every event.

​Thanks for supporting our growing mission!

​​ **_\*For any other questions or special accommodations, please email bigbrainsanfrancisco@gmail.com._**

speaker_insight:
**
Alex Brown is the Co-founder and CEO of Alga Biosciences, a company focused on developing sustainable solutions using algae. Prior to Alga Biosciences, he held various roles in the energy sector, including positions at Greentown Labs and MIT. He has a background in chemical engineering and a passion for developing innovative technologies that address climate change. Alex earned degrees from MIT. He is actively involved in the cleantech and biotech communities.

About Event

​​​Join us for **Techstars San Francisco Demo Day** and see our newest class of founders share the innovative companies they're building - featuring special live Q&As with our Entrepreneurs in Residence!

​These founders are building the next generation of AI vertical solutions for sales enablement, adtech, healthcare, legaltech and so much more. Join us in celebrating their progress over the last 3 months!

​​Techstars San Francisco is proud to continue our partnership with the Google Cloud. This partnership gives early stage startups in Techstars programs access to a breadth of Google resources designed for early-stage startup founders unlock the full potential of Google Cloud, including its latest innovations in AI.​

​​​Agenda:

​​​3:30 pm: Doors open and networking

​​4:15 pm: LAST ENTRY

​​​4:15 pm - 6:00 pm: Managing Director Remarks & Company Presentations

​​6:00 pm - 7:30 pm: Cocktail Networking Hour + Refreshments

​​​With any questions, please contact Chloe Lannert, Program Manager at Techstars San Francisco [chloe.lannert@techstars.com](mailto:chloe.lannert@techstars.com)

​Thank you to our brilliant GNPs!

**Emmett Shear** served as CEO of Twitch until recently when he started his new company, [Softmax](https://softmax.com/), with the mission to solve the AI alignment problem.

In this in person Ask Me Anything session, we will discuss with Emmett the mission of Softmax, how he envisions tackling the AI alignment problem, AGI, post-AGI scenarios, building an AI company in 2025, and many other topics.

speaker_insight:
**
Emmett Shear is an entrepreneur and investor, currently at Softmax. He is best known as the co-founder and former CEO of Twitch, a live video streaming platform focused on gaming. Twitch was acquired by Amazon in 2014. Shear stepped down as CEO of Twitch in March 2023. Prior to Twitch, he co-founded Justin.tv with Justin Kan, Michael Seibel, and Kyle Vogt. He has a degree in computer science from Yale University.

speaker_details: Mark currently leads Intercom's Integrated Marketing strategy, and since 2019 has built 2 global programs from scratch, including Partner Marketing and their global Webinar Program. He and his team are now focused on scaling Integrated Marketing and launching a paid Influencer program. # Scaling AI Companies with Creator Partnerships

Hosted by Amanda Branson & Jennifer Phan

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

6:00 PM - 8:30 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Creators have become the ultimate growth engine for AI companies, and [Passionfroot](http://www.passionfroot.me/) is hosting an exclusive event in partnership to explore how AI companies are using creators to scale. This is a unique opportunity to learn from industry leaders, share actionable strategies, and connect with like-minded marketers, founders and growth experts.

​Hear from our incredible panelists:

- ​ [Mark Iafrate](https://www.linkedin.com/in/markiafrate/), Integrated Marketing @ [Intercom](https://www.intercom.com/)

  - ​Mark currently leads Intercom's Integrated Marketing strategy, and since 2019 has built 2 global programs from scratch, including Partner Marketing and their global Webinar Program. He and his team are now focused on scaling Integrated Marketing and launching a paid Influencer program. Previously, he worked in marketing and product roles at early-stage startups, founded a SaaS company in 2014, and sold his niche eCommerce business in 2024.

- ​ [Alex Lin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/goalexlin/), Growth Marketing @ **Replit**

  - ​Currently leading the Creator & Developer Community @ Replit, Alex brings experience in GTM, demand gen and marketing ops from previous roles at Enterprise Mobility, Lookout, Kalio Commerce and SLI Systems.

- ​ [Kristin Fracchia](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristinfracchia/), Head of Marketing @ **Gamma**

  - ​Prior to leading marketing @ Gamma, Kristin has held CMO and Head of Growth roles at Chegg, Firstcard and Magoosh.
- ​ [Lior Alexander](https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair/), Creator & Founder @ **AlphaSignal**

  - ​Lior has build a loyal following of over 170K on LinkedIn and 200K on his newsletter, Alpha Signal, which has become the go-to place for AI practitioners to learn about AI research, code and the latest news.

​moderated by **[Jennifer Phan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jenniferphn/?originalSubdomain=de)**, Co-founder/CEO @ [Passionfroot](https://www.passionfroot.me/).

* * *

## ​ **Program**

- ​6pm Welcome drinks & bites

- ​​6:30-7:15pm: Scaling AI companies with creator partnerships panel

- ​7:30-8.30pm: Social space & networking with drinks & bites


* * *

About Event

​Creators have become the ultimate growth engine for AI companies, and [Passionfroot](http://www.passionfroot.me/) is hosting an exclusive event in partnership to explore how AI companies are using creators to scale. This is a unique opportunity to learn from industry leaders, share actionable strategies, and connect with like-minded marketers, founders and growth experts.

​Hear from our incredible panelists:

- ​ [Mark Iafrate](https://www.linkedin.com/in/markiafrate/), Integrated Marketing @ [Intercom](https://www.intercom.com/)

  - ​Mark currently leads Intercom's Integrated Marketing strategy, and since 2019 has built 2 global programs from scratch, including Partner Marketing and their global Webinar Program. He and his team are now focused on scaling Integrated Marketing and launching a paid Influencer program. Previously, he worked in marketing and product roles at early-stage startups, founded a SaaS company in 2014, and sold his niche eCommerce business in 2024.

- ​ [Alex Lin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/goalexlin/), Growth Marketing @ **Replit**

  - ​Currently leading the Creator & Developer Community @ Replit, Alex brings experience in GTM, demand gen and marketing ops from previous roles at Enterprise Mobility, Lookout, Kalio Commerce and SLI Systems.

- ​ [Kristin Fracchia](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristinfracchia/), Head of Marketing @ **Gamma**

  - ​Prior to leading marketing @ Gamma, Kristin has held CMO and Head of Growth roles at Chegg, Firstcard and Magoosh.
- ​ [Lior Alexander](https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair/), Creator & Founder @ **AlphaSignal**

  - ​Lior has build a loyal following of over 170K on LinkedIn and 200K on his newsletter, Alpha Signal, which has become the go-to place for AI practitioners to learn about AI research, code and the latest news.

​moderated by **[Jennifer Phan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jenniferphn/?originalSubdomain=de)**, Co-founder/CEO @ [Passionfroot](https://www.passionfroot.me/).

event_name: Seats of Success: Immigrant Entrepreneurs Table
event_summary: This event is designed exclusively for immigrant entrepreneurs and small to medium-sized business owners who are working hard to grow their companies and businesses —often without the community support they truly need. Seats of Success is a call to listen, collaborate, and co-create solutions. Join us for an intimate and empowering gathering where your voice matters.
event_location: The Ameswell Hotel, Mountain View, California
speaker_details: Aytakin Aliyeva, the Founder of Femigrants Foundation, is a community builder and podcast host. She has been featured in Forbes and Business Insider and is recognized for her impactful work in supporting immigrant women in business.

About Event

​📍 **Ameswell Hotel, Mountain View, CA**

​📅 **Monday, May 26, 2025** \| 6 PM - 8:30 PM

​🥘 **Food:** NOT included. Will be served per guest's order.

​👔 **Dress Code:** Summer colors!

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=1303/editor-images/kz/240865a9-cef6-412c-a95a-078a0a3ba691.jpg)

​This event is designed exclusively for **immigrant entrepreneurs and small to medium-sized business owners** who are working hard to grow their companies and businesses —often without the community support they truly need.

​ **Seats of Success** is a call to **listen, collaborate, and co-create solutions**. Join us for an intimate and empowering gathering where your voice matters.

​ **What to expect:**

- ​ **Mastermind Circle:** Each attendee will introduce themselves and their business, and share specific areas where support is needed.

- ​ **Fireside Chat:** Hear from a successful immigrant entrepreneur who scaled her business to **$1M in annual revenue**, sharing the real lessons behind her growth.


​This event aims to build bridges between immigrant entrepreneurs, the community, and organizations that want to support them.

​Let’s uplift and invest in each other—because thriving immigrant businesses uplift entire communities.

​More exciting details will be announced shortly!

​\*Open to **ALL genders!**

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=533.3849728892332/editor-images/br/a83a3ad6-6cf8-4feb-903c-3b97d449b444.jpg)

​ **WHO SHOULD JOIN?**

​ **Immigrant entrepreneurs** who own or operate **small to medium businesses** and seek meaningful connections, tailored support, and **practical strategies for growth**.

​ **WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN?**

- ​Engage in an open, supportive dialogue to express your unique challenges and needs.

- ​Benefit from targeted insights and feedback from fellow entrepreneurs and industry leaders.

- ​Help Femigrants Foundation identify specific services and support structures tailored to empower your business and expand your clientele.


​ **FIRESIDE CHAT SPEAKER**

​To be announced soon!

​ **DRESS CODE:**

​ **Let's celebrate our unity in the spring colors of green or lavender and/or pink!**

​ **MENU:**

​ **Food and drinks are not included in the event ticket.** We will gather at the Ameswell Hotel which offers a great menu selection at the Rogers Restaurant. **_Guests are welcome to order directly from the menu at their own expense._**

​ **LOCATION:**

​Ameswell Hotel, venue details and instructions will be emailed to the registered guests a few days before the event

​ **RESERVATION:**

​P.S. We don't sell tickets at the door! Please register on Luma before joining the event.

​ **The tickets are non-refundable.**

## ​ **EVENT ORGANIZER**

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=954.8387096774194/editor-images/lj/27ce633f-e523-4d8f-8ca4-7568c2dfba38.jpg)

​​This event is organized by **[AYTAKIN ALIYEVA](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aytakin-aliyeva-femigrants/)** **,** Forbes and Business Insider Featured Community Builder and Founder of the [Femigrants Foundation](https://femigrants.com/).

​Aytakin is a **podcast host** of the " [Verso Talk with Aytakin](https://www.youtube.com/@VersoTalkwithAytakin)" and the **[LinkedIn Influencer](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aytakin-aliyeva-femigrants/)** **and Content Creator**.

​​​ **_[Femigrants](https://femigrants.com/)_** **_(501c3) is a global community of diverse female immigrants in business and STEAM in Silicon Valley. We connect immigrant women to business and career growth resources through unique and memorable event experiences._**

​​​As the Founder of the Femigrants Foundation, Aytakin orchestrates exceptional event experiences in Silicon Valley, fostering meaningful connections among female immigrants from diverse backgrounds and equipping them with valuable career and business resources.

​​​Aytakin's impactful work as a community leader has earned her international recognition, including **double gold awards from the prestigious Women Changing The World Awards.** Additionally, she was honored as one of the **Top 25 Female Influencers of 2023 by WomElle**, solidifying her position as a trailblazer in her field.

​​​Her compelling journey in cultivating the Femigrants community has garnered widespread attention, earning her media coverage in esteemed outlets such as **Forbes, Business Insider, Yahoo Finance (twice), AP News, Washington Post, Intuit, Huffmag, London Daily Post**, and more.

​​​Besides leading the Femigrants Foundation, Aytakin worked at Fortune 500 Tech companies such as Instagram, Oculus, NVIDIA, and HTC VIVE, leading digital marketing and creative operations teams.

## ​ **PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT TERMS**

​​​ _\*You and your guest must be 21+ with ID to attend this event_.

​​​ **Political and Religious Discourse:**

​​​Femigrants Foundation is a nonpartisan organization (501c3).

​​​ **_\*_** **The Femigrants Foundation does not endorse any political or religious viewpoints, and we do not approve of any discussions or speeches about political issues or religion.** ​

​​​We encourage all members, participants, volunteers, speakers, and sponsors to respect this principle and engage in dialogue that aligns with our mission of **empowerment, connection, and support for female immigrants.**

* * *

​​​ **Assumption of Responsibility:**

By participating in this event, you acknowledge your responsibility for any accidents or damages that may be caused by your actions. Furthermore, you agree not to hold the Femigrants Foundation or any of the event supporters accountable for any losses, damages, injuries, or unforeseeable incidents.

​​​ **Consent to Share Information with Sponsors:**

​​​By registering for this event, you consent to the sharing of your full name and email address with our event sponsors. This information may be used for sponsor-related communications and networking purposes. We respect your privacy, and your details will only be shared with our trusted sponsors. If you have any concerns, please contact us directly prior to the event.

​​​ **Media Release:**

In the course of your participation in the event, you grant Femigrants Foundation permission to capture photographs and videos for event documentation and promotional purposes.

​​​By registering for Femigrants events, you grant permission for your photos and videos to be featured in news media, news articles, or related media outlets for marketing purposes.

​​​Your agreement also acknowledges the potential inclusion of visual content captured during the event in various Femigrants' media outlets, including but not limited to Femigrants' website, social media platforms, newsletters, and other promotional materials.

​​​ **Consent to Email Communication:**

By registering for this event, you consent to receive email communications from the Femigrants Foundation and its affiliated programs regarding event updates and information that may be of interest to you.

​​​ **Non-Refundable Tickets:**

Please be aware that tickets for this event are non-refundable. If you are unable to attend, you retain the option to transfer your ticket to a friend or team member who can attend in your stead. Please email [events@femigrants.com](mailto:events@femigrants.com) to transfer your ticket. **A minimum of 7 business days before the event** is required to transfer your ticket to your friend or colleague. **We do not accept last-minute requests.**

## ​ **You're invited to PizzaDAO's 5th annual Global Pizza Party on May 22 in honor of Bitcoin Pizza Day. There are over 400 events organized for the same day all over the world. See all the cities here on the website:** **[globalpizza.party](https://globalpizza.party/)**

* * *

​It'll be 15 years to the day since Bitcoin was first used to buy a real-world asset. On May 22, 2010, Laszlo Hanyecz bought two pizzas for 10,000 BTC. Today, that's over $1B Dollars (up $400M from last year). That's a pretty big f'ing deal!

​Thanks to our partners Berlinhouse Frontier Tower PizzaDAO, Dabl Club, [langrenusfund.com](https://langrenusfund.com/), [Aiify.io](https://aiify.io/), Polygon, OffChain Global, Hadron Founders Club, ZKM, House of Web3, Homebrew Crypto Club, [Zo.xyz](http://zo.xyz/), Polygon, Chainlink, [DAOPlanet.org](http://daoplanet.org/), OnePieceLabs, CryptoMondays, and more, we are throwing the biggest Pizza Party ever, right here in San Francisco!

# ​ **Berlinhouse SF Frontier Tower:**

​Berlinhouse's first installation, the SF-based Frontier Tower, is a self-organized community lab in frontier tech space with a blend of innovative arts & music artists.

​We are transforming a 92,000 sqft, **16-floor tower in the heart of SF** to give frontier-tech communities the space to build, grow, and thrive. This will be a citizen-only vertical village, the first node in a network state spanning multiple cities.

​Existing **AI, biotech, crypto, longevity, deep tech, human coordination, neuroscience, music&art** communities will each receive a 4,250 sqft floor—a blank canvas for pioneers to shape the future of how our society will live in a post AI-singularity world.

​We are actively onboarding local communities on eight different floors. The Berlinhouse Team will host joint floors with a library for co-working and a comfortable lounge to bring your friends, investors, or guests while enjoying a panoramic view of the city.

​ **Apply to become a founding member:** [https://berlinhouse.com/membership](https://berlinhouse.com/membership?referral_code=D3CUD9LW)

## ​ **Polygon Labs**

​Polygon Labs researchers and engineers have designed the aggregation layer, a novel solution to unify the whole of Web3. Like the invention of TCP/IP, which created a seamlessly unified Internet, the aggregation layer, or AggLayer, unites a divided blockchain landscape into a web of ZK-secured L1 and L2 chains that feels like a single chain.

## ​ **[Cookbook.dev](http://cookbook.dev/)**

​Cookbook is an open-source smart contract registry where developers can find solidity primitives, libraries, and smart contracts for protocols across EVM-compatible blockchains that rely on the solidity programming language.

## ​ **LG Fund**

​With a focus on Web3 and AI, the team boasts global coverage and a track record of over 35 showcases, supporting founders from inception to launch and beyond. The LG Fund welcomes collaborations, ideas, and inquiries from anyone deeply invested in the industry. [Website](https://www.langrenusfund.com/) \| [Twitter](https://x.com/LangrenusFund)

## ​ **Hito**

​Hito is the next gen hardware crypto wallet with on/off ramp, swaps, yield, and tap to pay. Open-source and made in USA - [x.com/hito\_xyz](https://x.com/hito_xyz)

## ​ **ZKM**

​ZKM is extending Bitcoin through its Entangled Rollup Network, offering native asset security and sustainable yield. Our mission is to unite the fragmented Web3 universe via its zkVM, establishing ZKM as the Global Settlement Network.

Learn more: [https://www.zkm.io](https://www.zkm.io/)

## ​ **[Aiify.io](http://aiify.io/)**

​ [Aiify.io](http://aiify.io/) events explore AI capabilities today, and the promise AI holds for tomorrow. Meet and learn from leaders building and using the cutting edge tools that are changing the world. Our next major event: Human+Tech Week Summit (June 17-19), Explores Human Potential in the Age of AI: [humantechweek.com](http://humantechweek.com/?utm_source=aiifypizza)

Also, StepSF 2025 is coming up Aug. 20-21: [StepSF.com](http://stepsf.com/?utm_source=aiifypizza)

## ​ **[Zo.xyz](http://zo.xyz/)**

​The ultimate crypto club where luxury meets innovation. Exclusive access to clubhouses, lifestyle events, and Web3 innovations. Join us to unlock the future of crypto. ⛓️🚀 Learn more on [https://zo.xyz/](https://zo.xyz/)

## ​ **[DAOPlanet.org](http://daoplanet.org/)**

​ [DAOPlanet.org](http://daoplanet.org/) (producer of [DAODenver.org](http://daodenver.org/)) is enabling a new age of work that better serves humanity — achieved through the integration and proliferation of DAO principles and Web3 tools. DAOPlanet’s mission is to deliver access to strategies, tools, and practices that support greater individual productivity, flexibility, and representation within all organizations.

## ​ **OffChain Global, San Francisco**

​OffChain is a global community for Web3 professionals and enthusiasts with over seventy chapters. We welcome a wide range of like-minded people from blockchain developers to crypto VC’s to miners to quant traders to people who just own a little Bitcoin. We welcome everyone who has an interest in blockchain and crypto. [www.offchain.social](https://www.offchain.social/)

## ​ **CryptoMondays San Francisco**

​CryptoMondays is a decentralized global community that shares a passion for crypto, blockchain and how it's going to change the world in dramatic ways. The San Francisco chapter is one of 70 global CryptoMonday chapters. CryptoMondays San Francisco hosts local meetups with presentations and panels, where people can learn, network, and have a blast. Email Kyle ( [kyle@cryptocontent.co](mailto:kyle@cryptocontent.co)) or Shaun ( [scgeer@gmail.com](mailto:scgeer@gmail.com)) if interested in speaking, sponsoring, or volunteering.

## ​ **​​​​OnePiece Labs**

​​​​​OnePiece Labs is a leading Web3 incubator, offers startups networking, mentorship, and resources for success. Founded by seasoned Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, it aims to cultivate the future's Web3 unicorns through results-driven outcomes.

event_name: NAVIGATING INFLUENCE: Persuasion Strategies for the Modern Professional
event_summary: In today's dynamic business environment, the ability to persuade, influence, and build consensus is paramount. Join us for an insightful workshop, led by Prof. Giuseppe Conti, a renowned professor of Negotiation, as he unveils powerful techniques to enhance your persuasive abilities. Discover practical strategies to navigate complex challenges, drive results, and inspire action across diverse industries - whether you are an entrepreneur trying to close deals, an in-house professional seeking to move ideas or position forward, a career changer seeking to clearly sell your value to stand out amongst the crowd. This session offers valuable insights for curious professionals seeking to amplify their impact and achieve greater success. After the conversation with Prof. Conti, you will have the opportunity to expand your professional network, connecting with fellow alumni from leading business school associations (Bocconi, MIT Sloan, NYU Stern, IMD, ESADE, INSEAD, LBS). Don't miss this chance to gain valuable insights and forge new connections.
host_name: Bocconi Alumni SF, London Business School San Francisco Bay Area Alumni & INSEAD Alumni Association SF & Bay Area
speaker_details: Giuseppe Conti is the founder and managing director of CABL, a firm that offers a range of customized training in the field of negotiation and influencing, and related areas. Giuseppe is a seasoned negotiator combining academic content with over 25 years of practitioner experience from his senior Procurement and commercial leadership roles within blue-chip multinationals (Procter & Gamble, Novartis, Firmenich and Merck). Since 2005, Giuseppe has been an award-winning Lecturer, recognized for his lively and interactive training workshops across leading business schools in three continents: Bayes, BSL, Cambridge, EPFL, ESADE, ESSEC, HEC Lausanne, HEC Paris, IESE, IMD, Imperial College, INSEAD, London Business School, Oxford, RSM, SDA Bocconi, University of Geneva, University of St Gallen and VU Amsterdam. To date, corporate leaders from multinational corporations and individuals from over 145 different countries have attended his workshops. In 2025, he was ranked #1 worldwide among the Top 30 Global Gurus for Negotiation.

# NAVIGATING INFLUENCE: Persuasion Strategies for the Modern Professional

Hosted by Bocconi Alumni SF, London Business School San Francisco Bay Area Alumni & INSEAD Alumni Association SF & Bay Area

May

22

Thursday, May 22

5:30 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Ticket Price

$20.00

Welcome! To join the event, please get your ticket below.

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​In today's dynamic business environment, **the ability to persuade, influence, and build consensus is paramount**. Join us for an insightful workshop, led by **Prof. Giuseppe Conti,** a renowned professor of Negotiation, as he unveils **powerful techniques to enhance your persuasive abilities**. Discover practical strategies to navigate complex challenges, drive results, and inspire action across diverse industries - whether you are an **entrepreneur** trying to close deals, an **in-house professional** seeking to move ideas or position forward, **a career changer** seeking to clearly sell your value to stand out amongst the crowd.

​This session offers valuable insights for **curious professionals seeking to amplify their impact and achieve greater success**.

​After the conversation with Prof. Conti, you will have the opportunity to expand your professional network, **connecting with fellow alumni from leading business school associations** ( **Bocconi, MIT Sloan, NYU Stern, IMD, ESADE, INSEAD, LBS**).

​Don't miss this chance to gain valuable insights and forge new connections.

​ _Registration is required (a wait-list is available once capacity is reached)_

​ **ABOUT GIUSEPPE CONTI:**

​Giuseppe Conti is the founder and managing director of CABL ( [www.cabl.ch](http://www.cabl.ch/)), a firm that offers a range of customized training in the field of negotiation and , influencing, and related areas. Giuseppe is a seasoned negotiator combining academic content with over 25 years of practitioner experience from his senior Procurement and commercial leadership roles within blue-chip multinationals (Procter & Gamble, Novartis, Firmenich and Merck). Since 2005, Giuseppe has been an award-winning Lecturer, recognized for his lively and interactive training workshops across leading business schools in three continents: Bayes, BSL, Cambridge, EPFL, ESADE, ESSEC, HEC Lausanne, HEC Paris, IESE, IMD, Imperial College, INSEAD, London Business School, Oxford, RSM, SDA Bocconi, University of Geneva, University of St Gallen and VU Amsterdam. To date, corporate leaders from multinational corporations and individuals from over 145 different countries have attended his workshops. In 2025, he was ranked #1 worldwide among the [Top 30 Global Gurus for](https://globalgurus.org/negotiation-gurus-top-30/) [Negotiation.](https://globalgurus.org/negotiation-gurus-top-30/) \[ [LinkedIn Profile](https://www.linkedin.com/in/giuseppeconti/)\]

​ **LOCATION**: SAN FRANCISCO, next to SoMa Caltrain Station (details will be provided upon registration)

​ **AGENDA**:

​Registration 5.30 - 6:00 pm

​Speech 6:00 - 6:30 pm

​Q&A 6:30 - 7:00 pm

​Networking 7:00 - 8.00pm

​

Ticket Price

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

# ​ **Immortality or Death**

​ _A Manifesto-Exhibition and Launch of the Eponymous Book_

​

## ​ **Why This Matters**

​For centuries, humanity has stormed the citadel of aging, only to discover that each scientific conquest reveals yet another rampart. The farther we press into the biology of senescence, the more labyrinthine the problem becomes—so vast that the very coordinates of “life,” “time,” and “consciousness” seem irretrievable, up for renegotiation, possibly undiscoverable.

​Despite the repeated failed assaults of empirical methods, the will to live—our most instinctual and inextinguishable "flame"—vaults past the barricades. Indeed, it is in the province of art that we witness this flame burn.

​In Immortality or Death, we see six artists wield that flame, showing us the stakes are high as they explore what might lie beyond the barricades.

​

## ​ **Your Experience**

​Seven radical vitalists— **Misha Batin, Dominique Darvas, Nastya Egorova, Mark Hamalainen, Yan Granat, Olga Posukh, and Liza Povysheva**—tear open the familiar Longevity playbook and scatter its pages to the wind. Their canvases and installations prod five questions that refuse polite silence:

​ 1\. _Whose life are we trying to prolong—and what, exactly, is a “person”?_

​ 2\. _What lies beneath life’s habitual patterns?_

​ 3\. _If a life-affirming force propels us, what equal and opposite force impedes us?_

​ 4\. _Under what circumstances might our courage coalesce into a collective assault on mortality?_

​ 5\. _In which domains should we labor if we truly mean to invent an anti-aging cure?_

​Each work is a visual gauntlet, an intellectual slap, a dare to converse without euphemism.

​

## ​ **The Book Premiere**

​Opening night features science-writer-provocateur **Alexander Panchin**, unveiling _[Immortality or Death](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0F93JBB1D)_—a field guide to the biology of aging where rigor collides, headlong, with audacious futures.

​

## ​ **Why Come**

​This is not merely an art event; it is a **laboratory of the spirit**.

​ • The artworks function as experimental rigs for your convictions.

​ • The book doubles as a manual for translating the aesthetics of immortality into concrete strategy.

​ • You, the visitor, become a co-author of an unfolding future—one that must either defeat death or capitulate to it, irrevocably.

​If your appetite for life refuses the comforts of actuarial tables—if yesterday’s answers feel threadbare—join us **May 22 at 17:00**. Witness how art sharpens itself into a new instrument for species-level self-preservation.

​Because **Immortality or Death** is not a rhetorical flourish. It is the decision history now places in our hands.

​ _We will have two tours on May 22nd: at 5pm and at 7pm._

​ _Admission: $20_

​ _Dress-code: elevated / futuristic_

​ _Immortality drinks, snacks and guided discussions are provided._

​Opening night features science-writer-provocateur **Alexander Panchin**, unveiling _[Immortality or Death](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0F93JBB1D)_—a field guide to the biology of aging where rigor collides, headlong, with audacious futures.

​

## ​ **Why Come**

​This is not merely an art event; it is a **laboratory of the spirit**.

​ • The artworks function as experimental rigs for your convictions.

​ • The book doubles as a manual for translating the aesthetics of immortality into concrete strategy.

​ • You, the visitor, become a co-author of an unfolding future—one that must either defeat death or capitulate to it, irrevocably.

​If your appetite for life refuses the comforts of actuarial tables—if yesterday’s answers feel threadbare—join us **May 22 at 17:00**. Witness how art sharpens itself into a new instrument for species-level self-preservation.

​Because **Immortality or Death** is not a rhetorical flourish. It is the decision history now places in our hands.

​ _We will have two tours on May 22nd: at 5pm and at 7pm._

​ _Admission: $20_

​ _Dress-code: elevated / futuristic_

​ _Immortality drinks, snacks and guided discussions are provided._

speaker_insight:
**
Alexander Panchin is a Russian science writer, biologist, and translator. He is a well-known popularizer of science in Russia and a critic of pseudoscience. His research interests include evolutionary biology, bioinformatics, and the problem of extending lifespan. He is a senior researcher at the Institute for Information Transmission Problems (Kharkevich Institute) of the Russian Academy of Sciences. He is also known for his skeptical and provocative stance on various scientific and societal issues. He is the author of multiple books on science and pseudoscience.

About Event

​Hey, Bay Area builders and tinkerers!

This time we are hosted by Cisco Meraki and sponsored by Gusto! We are quickly crafting the agenda now, and it's going to be amazing thanks to all of you.

🎙️ Submit a talk proposal here:​ [https://forms.gle/C9HQzaT5jvwA5xwc7](https://forms.gle/C9HQzaT5jvwA5xwc7)

​Ruby is the quiet force behind the Bay Area's most successful tech organizations and startups from GitHub, Shopify and Stripe to Figma, Chime, and [bolt.new](https://bolt.new/).

​We are gathering every month to learn, share, inspire each other, and it feels great because of MINASWAN 💗.

​Our meetups explore building and scaling Ruby and Rails applications. We go deep into technical topics and don't shy away from new ideas and weird experiments! We always have an open mic for everyone's announcements or questions🎙️! Join us in discovering the nicest Ruby HQs 🏙️❤️

Catch you on the flip side! A massive shoutout to **Cisco Meraki** for hosting!

​Agenda:

Fito von Zastrow & Alan Ridlehoover (Cisco Meraki): Derailing Our Application: How and Why We Are Decoupling Ourselves from Rails

Obie Fernandez (Shopify): Structured AI Workflows at Scale with Roast

Todd Kummer (Rockridge Solutions): Deploying a hobby project on Rails 8 and Kamal

Victoria Melnikova (Evil Martians): Ruby events not to miss in 2025

​Brandon Weaver (One Medical): Red in Fantasyland

Brought to you by [Evil Martians](http://evilmartians.com/).

# SF Ruby Meetup, May @ Cisco Meraki

[SF Bay Area Ruby Meetup](https://lu.ma/sfruby?k=c)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

5:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[Cisco Meraki\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Cisco%20Meraki&query_place_id=ChIJD8-dpDB-j4ARxcoy6zNIIpc)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Hey, Bay Area builders and tinkerers!

This time we are hosted by Cisco Meraki and sponsored by Gusto! We are quickly crafting the agenda now, and it's going to be amazing thanks to all of you.

🎙️ Submit a talk proposal here:​ [https://forms.gle/C9HQzaT5jvwA5xwc7](https://forms.gle/C9HQzaT5jvwA5xwc7)

​Ruby is the quiet force behind the Bay Area's most successful tech organizations and startups from GitHub, Shopify and Stripe to Figma, Chime, and [bolt.new](https://bolt.new/).

​We are gathering every month to learn, share, inspire each other, and it feels great because of MINASWAN 💗.

​Our meetups explore building and scaling Ruby and Rails applications. We go deep into technical topics and don't shy away from new ideas and weird experiments! We always have an open mic for everyone's announcements or questions🎙️! Join us in discovering the nicest Ruby HQs 🏙️❤️

Catch you on the flip side! A massive shoutout to **Cisco Meraki** for hosting!

​Agenda:

Fito von Zastrow & Alan Ridlehoover (Cisco Meraki): Derailing Our Application: How and Why We Are Decoupling Ourselves from Rails

Obie Fernandez (Shopify): Structured AI Workflows at Scale with Roast

Todd Kummer (Rockridge Solutions): Deploying a hobby project on Rails 8 and Kamal

Victoria Melnikova (Evil Martians): Ruby events not to miss in 2025

​Brandon Weaver (One Medical): Red in Fantasyland

Brought to you by [Evil Martians](http://evilmartians.com/).

P.S. The video from the last meetup is up on our RubyEvents page, as usual:

[https://www.rubyevents.org/talks/sf-bay-area-ruby-meetup-april-2025](https://www.rubyevents.org/talks/sf-bay-area-ruby-meetup-april-2025)

# 10th SJ Hardware Meetup in Mountain View @ AuSIM Garage

[San Jose Hardware Meetup](https://lu.ma/sj-hardware-meetup?k=c)

May

20

Tuesday, May 20

6:30 PM - 9:30 PM PDT

Register to See Address

Mountain View, California

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​We're excited to be hosting this next meetup at AuSIM!

​​​ [Hardware Meetups](https://hardwaremeetup.com/) happen in over 30 cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to collaborate, network and learn from each other.

## ​ **Speakers**

- ​ [Ryan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryanmwolff/) is a Sr. Industrial User Experience Specialist at [Liminal Insights.](https://www.liminalinsights.com/) He helps build industrial diagnostic tools that leverage ultrasound and machine learning for defect detection, quality control and process improvement of EV battery cells.

- ​ [William (Bill) Chapin](http://ausim3d.com/wlc/index.html), a veteran of Stanford's Product Design program and Center for Design Research, ran AuSIM, an audio simulation product developer for 20 years.  The incubator, [AuSIM Garage](http://www.ausim3d.com/), is a legacy of AuSIM.  Bill is now Sr. Mgr of Sensor Systems for Johnson & Johnson's surgical robotics programs.

- ​More TBA


​ **Agenda**

- ​6:30-7:00 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments

- ​7:00-7:05 - Welcome and introduction

- ​7:05-8:00 - Guest talks and audience Q+A

- ​8:00-8:30p - Community open mic


​​ Anyone will have the chance for a 30 second pitch to demo a prototype or talk about what they are working on.

- ​​8:30-9:30p - Mix + mingle


## ​ **Thank you to our host!**

- ​ [AuSIM](http://ausim3d.com/Garage/) manages a small incubation and co-working space, conveniently-located just off US Highway 101 within the Google campus in Mountain View, CA.



AuSIM, founded in 1998 originally in Palo Alto, now with facilities in Mountain View, is a leading developer and provider of audio simulation, positional (3D) sound, and audio measurement solutions that enhance sound perception.


## ​ **Thank you to our community partners!**

- ​ **[informal](http://informal.cc/)** is a freelance collective for the most talented independent professionals in hardware. Whether you're looking for a single contractor, a full-time employee, or an entire team of professionals to work on everything from product development to go-to-market strategy, the informal collective has the perfect collection of people for the job. **[Learn more](https://informal.cc/)** **.**


​If you want to help support the next meetup, please reach out to [nate@informal.cc](mailto:nate@informal.cc) for sponsorship inquiries.

​See you soon!

His work involves research, testing, and design.
