event_name: DaVinci Cafe: Longevity Series #2-The Brain
event_summary: In a world driven by rapid and complex challenges, innovation thrives at the convergence of technologies. By bringing together experts from different domain areas, we unlock new possibilities. Welcome to DaVinci Café, where thinkers, creators, and visionaries connect and collaborate.
speaker_details: Dr. Garrett Vygantas: Venture investor, CEO, serial entrepreneur. Garrett Vygantas, MD, MBA is Founder & Managing Partner of Riverine Ventures, a life science and healthcare dedicated venture capital firm. Trained as a physician and an experienced entrepreneur, Garrett provides strategic direction and valuable clinical and commercial networks as a Board Member or Advisor to Adventris Pharma, AEye Health, ArtiSight, CellFE, Ceria Therapeutics, Corsair Pharma, Eliksa Therapeutics, HealthBridge, Inflammatix, KeifeRx, Mediphage and Pieces Technologies. With over 20 years, Garrett’s expertise spans across biopharma, life sciences, healthcare, medtech and digital health investing and operations. Before founding Riverine Ventures, he has invested on behalf of The 4100 Group, OSF Healthcare, Jump Capital and Burrill & Co. As an operator, he served as Founding CEO of TherOptix, NewBridge Pharmaceuticals and Mitre Medical and Chief Business Officer of Corsair Pharma. At NewBridge, he and his team raised over $60M in financing and created $470M in nominal value. Dr. Alex Colville: Investor in Longevity. Dr. Alex Colville is the General Partner and cofounder of age1 alongside Laura Deming. age1 is the continuation of the first longevity-focused VC fund founded in 2011 by Laura (5 IPOs). Alex is an advisor and previously served as founding Chief of Staff of the Amaranth Foundation, a family office dedicated to advancing interventions to extend healthy human lifespan where he led investments into over 20 companies and supported philanthropic initiatives including AFAR and the TIME Initiative. Prior to working for family offices, Alex received a PhD in genetics at Stanford University studying rejuvenation and the biology of aging in Tom Rando's lab. During his PhD he consulted for the business development group at Maze Therapeutics and the scientific team at Rubedo Life Sciences. Dr. Christin Glorioso: CEO & Co-founder, NeuroAge Therapeutics | Founder & Executive Director, Longevity Global. Dr. Christin Glorioso is a neuroscientist, physician, and serial entrepreneur. She is co-founder and CEO of NeuroAge Therapeutics and Founder and Executive Director of the non-profit, Longevity Global. Christin completed her postdoctoral training at MIT and holds an MD and PhD in Neuroscience from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine. Dr. Kazu Okuda: Kazu Okuda, M.D. is a physician turned neuro‑technology entrepreneur driven to improve mental health care. Previously, he was involved in clinical development, fundraising, and ultimately securing regulatory clearance and national insurance reimbursement for an AI-powered medical device at a Japanese med-tech startup. He then moved to the United States to found Universal Brain in 2022, tackling a fundamental gap in psychiatry: the routine measurement of brain function. Universal Brain’s platform captures well-validated brain function measures, called event-related potentials (ERPs), that reflect core neural processes linked to depression and its treatment. By turning these EEG‑based measures into a scalable, clinic‑ready tool, he aims to make objective brain‑function testing a standard component of mental‑health care to get better outcomes—starting with depression and expanding across psychiatric conditions. Allison M. Leopold Tilley: Partner at Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP. Allison Leopold Tilley is named one of the top “Women Leaders in Tech Law” by The Recorder for six consecutive years and hailed as the Technology “Dealmaker of the Year” by The Deal. Based in Silicon Valley, Allison advises technology companies, including on their formation, venture capital financings, multibillion-dollar M&As, public offerings, securities transactions, SPAC transactions and board governance.

# DaVinci Cafe: Longevity Series \#2-The Brain

Hosted by Qing Z

Jun

4

Wednesday, June 4

5:00 PM - 7:00 PM PDT

[2550 Hanover St\\
\\
Palo Alto, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=2550%20Hanover%20St&query_place_id=ChIJJ4wUSeq6j4ARc4wNq3XxCmA)

Event Full

If you’d like, you can join the waitlist.

Please click on the button below to join the waitlist. You will be notified if additional spots become available.

Join Waitlist

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​ **About Event**

​​​In a world driven by rapid and complex challenges, innovation thrives at the **convergence** of technologies.

​​By bringing together experts from different domain areas, we unlock new possibilities.

​​Welcome to **_DaVinci Café_**, where thinkers, creators, and visionaries connect and collaborate.

​​ **🗓️ Agenda**

​​ **Date: June 4th**

​​ **Address:** 2550 Hanover Street \| Palo Alto, CA 94304-1115

​​​ **5:00 PM**: check in & networking

**5:30-6:30 PM**: Panel discussion + Q&A

**6:30-7:00 PM**: networking 🍕🍺

​​This event will include light appetizers, wine/beer and non-alcoholic beverages.

​​ **🎙️ Our speakers**

​Moderator

​Dr. Garrett Vygantas: Venture investor, CEO, serial entrepreneur.

​

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/pq/7e7535ac-3479-4276-b9ca-be23dc6e50e0.jpg)

​Garrett Vygantas, MD, MBA is Founder & Managing Partner of Riverine Ventures, a life science and healthcare dedicated venture capital firm. Trained as a physician and an experienced entrepreneur, Garrett provides strategic direction and valuable clinical and commercial networks as a Board Member or Advisor to Adventris Pharma, AEye Health, ArtiSight, CellFE, Ceria Therapeutics, Corsair Pharma, Eliksa Therapeutics, HealthBridge, Inflammatix, KeifeRx, Mediphage and Pieces Technologies.

​With over 20 years, Garrett’s expertise spans across biopharma, life sciences, healthcare, medtech and digital health investing and operations. Before founding Riverine Ventures, he has invested on behalf of The 4100 Group, OSF Healthcare, Jump Capital and Burrill & Co. As an operator, he served as Founding CEO of TherOptix, NewBridge Pharmaceuticals and Mitre Medical and Chief Business Officer of Corsair Pharma. At NewBridge, he and his team raised over $60M in financing and created $470M in nominal value.

​Panel speakers:

​1.       Dr. Alex Colville: Investor in Longevity

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/r1/f35b4680-1061-49d9-ad7e-360c5a835f42.jpg)

​Dr. Alex Colville is the General Partner and cofounder of age1 alongside Laura Deming. age1 is the continuation of the first longevity-focused VC fund founded in 2011 by Laura (5 IPOs). Alex is an advisor and previously served as founding Chief of Staff of the Amaranth Foundation, a family office dedicated to advancing interventions to extend healthy human lifespan where he led investments into over 20 companies and supported philanthropic initiatives including AFAR and the TIME Initiative. Prior to working for family offices, Alex received a PhD in genetics at Stanford University studying rejuvenation and the biology of aging in Tom Rando's lab. During his PhD he consulted for the business development group at Maze Therapeutics and the scientific team at Rubedo Life Sciences.

​2.       Dr. Christin Glorioso: CEO & Co-founder, NeuroAge Therapeutics \| Founder & Executive Director, Longevity Global

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ho/a00a13ba-cca5-4ac9-8163-e815e628273e.png)

​Dr. Christin Glorioso is a neuroscientist, physician, and serial entrepreneur.  She is co-founder and CEO of NeuroAge Therapeutics and Founder and Executive Director of the non-profit, Longevity Global. Christin completed her postdoctoral training at MIT and holds an MD and PhD in Neuroscience from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine.

​3\. Dr. Kazu Okuda

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/rc/b65514a5-3d5d-4c91-9c62-2d8b357b58c3.jpg)

​Kazu Okuda, M.D. is a physician turned neuro‑technology entrepreneur driven to improve mental health care. Previously, he was involved in clinical development, fundraising, and ultimately securing regulatory clearance and national insurance reimbursement for an AI-powered medical device at a Japanese med-tech startup. He then moved to the United States to found Universal Brain in 2022, tackling a fundamental gap in psychiatry: the routine measurement of brain function.Universal Brain’s platform captures well-validated brain function measures, called event-related potentials (ERPs), that reflect core neural processes linked to depression and its treatment. By turning these EEG‑based measures into a scalable, clinic‑ready tool, he aims to make objective brain‑function testing a standard component of mental‑health care to get better outcomes—starting with depression and expanding across psychiatric conditions.

​4\. **[Allison M. Leopold Tilley](https://www.linkedin.com/in/allison-leopold-tilley/)** Partner at Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/1y/4b3fcbc0-9b45-473a-9679-8cbb4e496148.webp)

​​ **Allison Leopold Tilley is named one of the top “Women Leaders in Tech Law” by** **_The Recorder_** **for six consecutive years and hailed as the Technology “Dealmaker of the Year” by** **_The Deal._** **Based in Silicon Valley, Allison advises technology companies, including on their formation, venture capital financings, multibillion-dollar M&As, public offerings, securities transactions, SPAC transactions and board governance.**

​ **About the hosts & sponsors:**

​​​​​​​​​​Hosts: Davinci Cafe: Where thinkers, creators, and visionaries from every industry connect, collaborate, and shape the future. Find your tribe, your partners, and your inspiration.

​​​Sponsors: Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP: ​​A global law firm focusing on the Tech, Energy, Financial, Real Estate & Construction, and Life Sciences industries.

​​​​ _Please note, this event may be photographed and filmed. Davinci Cafe reserves the right to use photographs and video from the event for marketing and communications purposes. By attending the event you consent to your image being used for these purposes._

_To maintain the integrity of our peer collaboration and to respect venue capacity, we will not accommodate walk-ins or +1s for the event. Thank you in advance for your cooperation._

Palo Alto, CA 94304, USA

speaker_insight: Dr. Garrett Vygantas is the Founder and Managing Partner of Riverine Ventures. He focuses on investments in early-stage companies. His expertise spans technology, healthcare, and venture capital. He has a medical degree. He has experience advising and supporting companies across various stages of growth.

At NewBridge, he and his team raised over $60M in financing and created $470M in nominal value.

​Panel speakers:

​1.       Dr. Alex Colville: Investor in Longevity

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/r1/f35b4680-1061-49d9-ad7e-360c5a835f42.jpg)

​Dr. Alex Colville is the General Partner and cofounder of age1 alongside Laura Deming. age1 is the continuation of the first longevity-focused VC fund founded in 2011 by Laura (5 IPOs). Alex is an advisor and previously served as founding Chief of Staff of the Amaranth Foundation, a family office dedicated to advancing interventions to extend healthy human lifespan where he led investments into over 20 companies and supported philanthropic initiatives including AFAR and the TIME Initiative. Prior to working for family offices, Alex received a PhD in genetics at Stanford University studying rejuvenation and the biology of aging in Tom Rando's lab. During his PhD he consulted for the business development group at Maze Therapeutics and the scientific team at Rubedo Life Sciences.

​2.       Dr. Christin Glorioso: CEO & Co-founder, NeuroAge Therapeutics \| Founder & Executive Director, Longevity Global

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ho/a00a13ba-cca5-4ac9-8163-e815e628273e.png)

​Dr. Christin Glorioso is a neuroscientist, physician, and serial entrepreneur.  She is co-founder and CEO of NeuroAge Therapeutics and Founder and Executive Director of the non-profit, Longevity Global. Christin completed her postdoctoral training at MIT and holds an MD and PhD in Neuroscience from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine.

​3\. Dr. Kazu Okuda

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/rc/b65514a5-3d5d-4c91-9c62-2d8b357b58c3.jpg)

​Kazu Okuda, M.D. is a physician turned neuro‑technology entrepreneur driven to improve mental health care. Previously, he was involved in clinical development, fundraising, and ultimately securing regulatory clearance and national insurance reimbursement for an AI-powered medical device at a Japanese med-tech startup. He then moved to the United States to found Universal Brain in 2022, tackling a fundamental gap in psychiatry: the routine measurement of brain function.Universal Brain’s platform captures well-validated brain function measures, called event-related potentials (ERPs), that reflect core neural processes linked to depression and its treatment. By turning these EEG‑based measures into a scalable, clinic‑ready tool, he aims to make objective brain‑function testing a standard component of mental‑health care to get better outcomes—starting with depression and expanding across psychiatric conditions.

​4\. **[Allison M. Leopold Tilley](https://www.linkedin.com/in/allison-leopold-tilley/)** Partner at Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/1y/4b3fcbc0-9b45-473a-9679-8cbb4e496148.webp)

​​ **Allison Leopold Tilley is named one of the top “Women Leaders in Tech Law” by** **_The Recorder_** **for six consecutive years and hailed as the Technology “Dealmaker of the Year” by** **_The Deal._** **Based in Silicon Valley, Allison advises technology companies, including on their formation, venture capital financings, multibillion-dollar M&As, public offerings, securities transactions, SPAC transactions and board governance.**

​ **About the hosts & sponsors:**

​​​​​​​​​​Hosts: Davinci Cafe: Where thinkers, creators, and visionaries from every industry connect, collaborate, and shape the future. Find your tribe, your partners, and your inspiration.

​​​Sponsors: Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP: ​​A global law firm focusing on the Tech, Energy, Financial, Real Estate & Construction, and Life Sciences industries.

​​​​ _Please note, this event may be photographed and filmed. Davinci Cafe reserves the right to use photographs and video from the event for marketing and communications purposes. By attending the event you consent to your image being used for these purposes._

_To maintain the integrity of our peer collaboration and to respect venue capacity, we will not accommodate walk-ins or +1s for the event. Thank you in advance for your cooperation._

She also has experience in business development and fundraising.

About Event

​ **About Event**

​​​In a world driven by rapid and complex challenges, innovation thrives at the **convergence** of technologies.

​​By bringing together experts from different domain areas, we unlock new possibilities.

​​Welcome to **_DaVinci Café_**, where thinkers, creators, and visionaries connect and collaborate.

​​ **🗓️ Agenda**

​​ **Date: June 4th**

​​ **Address:** 2550 Hanover Street \| Palo Alto, CA 94304-1115

​​​ **5:00 PM**: check in & networking

**5:30-6:30 PM**: Panel discussion + Q&A

**6:30-7:00 PM**: networking 🍕🍺

​​This event will include light appetizers, wine/beer and non-alcoholic beverages.

​​ **🎙️ Our speakers**

​Moderator

​Dr. Garrett Vygantas: Venture investor, CEO, serial entrepreneur.

​

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/pq/7e7535ac-3479-4276-b9ca-be23dc6e50e0.jpg)

​Garrett Vygantas, MD, MBA is Founder & Managing Partner of Riverine Ventures, a life science and healthcare dedicated venture capital firm. Trained as a physician and an experienced entrepreneur, Garrett provides strategic direction and valuable clinical and commercial networks as a Board Member or Advisor to Adventris Pharma, AEye Health, ArtiSight, CellFE, Ceria Therapeutics, Corsair Pharma, Eliksa Therapeutics, HealthBridge, Inflammatix, KeifeRx, Mediphage and Pieces Technologies.

​With over 20 years, Garrett’s expertise spans across biopharma, life sciences, healthcare, medtech and digital health investing and operations. Before founding Riverine Ventures, he has invested on behalf of The 4100 Group, OSF Healthcare, Jump Capital and Burrill & Co. As an operator, he served as Founding CEO of TherOptix, NewBridge Pharmaceuticals and Mitre Medical and Chief Business Officer of Corsair Pharma. At NewBridge, he and his team raised over $60M in financing and created $470M in nominal value.

​Panel speakers:

​1.       Dr. Alex Colville: Investor in Longevity

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/r1/f35b4680-1061-49d9-ad7e-360c5a835f42.jpg)

​Dr. Alex Colville is the General Partner and cofounder of age1 alongside Laura Deming. age1 is the continuation of the first longevity-focused VC fund founded in 2011 by Laura (5 IPOs). Alex is an advisor and previously served as founding Chief of Staff of the Amaranth Foundation, a family office dedicated to advancing interventions to extend healthy human lifespan where he led investments into over 20 companies and supported philanthropic initiatives including AFAR and the TIME Initiative. Prior to working for family offices, Alex received a PhD in genetics at Stanford University studying rejuvenation and the biology of aging in Tom Rando's lab. During his PhD he consulted for the business development group at Maze Therapeutics and the scientific team at Rubedo Life Sciences.

​2.       Dr. Christin Glorioso: CEO & Co-founder, NeuroAge Therapeutics \| Founder & Executive Director, Longevity Global

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/ho/a00a13ba-cca5-4ac9-8163-e815e628273e.png)

​Dr. Christin Glorioso is a neuroscientist, physician, and serial entrepreneur.  She is co-founder and CEO of NeuroAge Therapeutics and Founder and Executive Director of the non-profit, Longevity Global. Christin completed her postdoctoral training at MIT and holds an MD and PhD in Neuroscience from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine.

​3\. Dr. Kazu Okuda

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=800/editor-images/rc/b65514a5-3d5d-4c91-9c62-2d8b357b58c3.jpg)

​Kazu Okuda, M.D. is a physician turned neuro‑technology entrepreneur driven to improve mental health care. Previously, he was involved in clinical development, fundraising, and ultimately securing regulatory clearance and national insurance reimbursement for an AI-powered medical device at a Japanese med-tech startup. He then moved to the United States to found Universal Brain in 2022, tackling a fundamental gap in psychiatry: the routine measurement of brain function.Universal Brain’s platform captures well-validated brain function measures, called event-related potentials (ERPs), that reflect core neural processes linked to depression and its treatment. By turning these EEG‑based measures into a scalable, clinic‑ready tool, he aims to make objective brain‑function testing a standard component of mental‑health care to get better outcomes—starting with depression and expanding across psychiatric conditions.

​4\. **[Allison M. Leopold Tilley](https://www.linkedin.com/in/allison-leopold-tilley/)** Partner at Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=1200/editor-images/1y/4b3fcbc0-9b45-473a-9679-8cbb4e496148.webp)

​​ **Allison Leopold Tilley is named one of the top “Women Leaders in Tech Law” by** **_The Recorder_** **for six consecutive years and hailed as the Technology “Dealmaker of the Year” by** **_The Deal._** **Based in Silicon Valley, Allison advises technology companies, including on their formation, venture capital financings, multibillion-dollar M&As, public offerings, securities transactions, SPAC transactions and board governance.**

speaker_insight: Anna Binder is the Chief People Officer at Asana, a leading work management platform. # SF ~ Women in Recruiting Fireside: Using AI Agents to Supercharge Your Recruiting Workflow

[Talent Collective](https://lu.ma/talentcollective?k=c)

May

22

Thursday, May 22

5:30 PM - 7:30 PM PDT

[110 S Park St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=110%20S%20Park%20St&query_place_id=ChIJhxOtwniAhYAR8L2H4sUqM0o)

Ticket Price

$15.00

Welcome! To join the event, please get your ticket below.

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​We’re teaming up with **[Juicebox](https://juicebox.ai/)** for an evening of candid conversation and community connection in the heart of San Francisco.

​Join us on **May 22nd** at Juicebox’s SF office for a relaxed fireside chat focused on **how to leverage AI and AI Agents in your recruiting workflow**. We'll dive into the evolving challenges—and huge opportunities—that AI brings to today’s talent teams, sharing practical ways to integrate new tools while staying human-first.

​ **Hear from a powerhouse panel featuring:**

​ [David Paffenholz](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-paffenholz/) \- CEO & Co-founder of Juicebox

​ [Mario Espindola](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-paffenholz/) \- Senior Director of Talent & Operations at SignalFire

​ [Melanie Graff](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mgraff/) \- VC Talent Partner and Head of Talent Acquisition at NFDG

​ [Tammy Dain](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tammydain/) \- Founder & CEO @ Rabble

​Drinks, light bites, and plenty of time to mingle with fellow women in TA included.

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=162.16216216216216/editor-images/15/ddfd4cd5-493a-41fd-8a0c-2fd8a27b7703.png)

​The modern AI-sourcing tool built for recruiters. They help top talent teams find, assess, and engage their next hire — faster. [Juicebox](https://juicebox.ai/) combines over 30 datasets, including LinkedIn, GitHub, and Crunchbase, with advanced AI models to find qualified talent by easily searching with natural language. Today, they're trusted by 1,500+ customers, including teams at leading AI labs, recruiting agencies, and high-growth companies like Patreon and Replit.

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=384/editor-images/2k/ed44c3f6-1f6f-4220-8800-cb9acec745a1)

​​​​​​​​ **[Talent Collective](http://www.talentcollectiveco.com/?referrer=luma)** is a community that empowers and connects women+ in talent acquisition through curated in-person and virtual professional development experiences to advance their careers and amplify their recruiting networks!

* * *

​​​​​​​​ _Talent Collective values your privacy. When you register for this event, we collect your name, email, LinkedIn profile, and other details. Please note that your information will be shared with all hosts of the event to facilitate coordination and communication. These hosts may use your information to send you relevant updates and offers related to the event._

​ _​​​​​​​​​We will not share your data with third parties outside of the event hosts, except as required by law. Your information is used solely for managing your participation and enhancing your experience. You can opt-out of communications at any time._

​ _​​​​​​​​​For any questions or concerns, please contact us at_ _[hi@talentcollectiveco.com](mailto:hi@talentcollectiveco.com)_

David Paffenholz is the CEO and Co-founder of Juicebox, a web3 project focused on crowdfunding and community building on the Ethereum blockchain. He is involved in decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) and focuses on innovative ways to manage and fund projects using crypto. About Event

​We’re teaming up with **[Juicebox](https://juicebox.ai/)** for an evening of candid conversation and community connection in the heart of San Francisco.

​Join us on **May 22nd** at Juicebox’s SF office for a relaxed fireside chat focused on **how to leverage AI and AI Agents in your recruiting workflow**. We'll dive into the evolving challenges—and huge opportunities—that AI brings to today’s talent teams, sharing practical ways to integrate new tools while staying human-first.

​ **Hear from a powerhouse panel featuring:**

​ [David Paffenholz](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-paffenholz/) \- CEO & Co-founder of Juicebox

​ [Mario Espindola](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-paffenholz/) \- Senior Director of Talent & Operations at SignalFire

​Drinks, light bites, and plenty of time to mingle with fellow women in TA included.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​8:00 - 9:00 - Registration and Breakfast

- ​9:00 - 10:45 - Session One

- ​10:45 - 11:00 - Morning Break

- ​11:00 - 12:30 - Session Two

- ​12:30 - 1:15 - Lunch

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception


​

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=200/editor-images/c3/554f095c-6a92-4efb-bed6-620b40a46949.png)

- ​ **A16Z**\- [Yoko Li](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yokoli/) \- Partner (AI & Infra Investment)

  - ​ _What MCP Middleware Could Look Like_
- ​ **Acorn Labs**\- [Darren Shepherd](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ibuildthecloud/) \- Chief Architect

  - ​ _Next Generation Agent Architectures with MCP_
- ​ **Amazon Web Services** \- [Antje Barth](https://www.linkedin.com/in/antje-barth/) \- Principal Developer Advocate

  - ​ _Scaling MCP_
- ​ **Amazon Web Services Generative AI** \- [Nicholas Aldridge](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholas-aldridge-341162a4/) \- Principal Engineer

  - ​ _Multi-Agent Collaboration in MCP_
- ​ **Anthropic** \- [David Soria Parra](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-soria-parra-4a78b3a/) \- Member of Technical Staff,

MCP Co-creator

  - ​ _Technical Keynote - MCP 201: The Protocol in Depth_
- ​ **Block**\- [Angie Jones](https://www.linkedin.com/in/angiejones/) \- VP Developer Relations

  - ​ _From Experiment to Enterprise: How Block Operationalized MCP at Scale_
- ​ **Bloomberg** \- [Sambhav Kothari](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sambhav-kothari/)\- Engineering Manager, Head of AI Productivity

  - ​ _Pragmatic Scaling of Enterprise GenAI with MCP_
- ​ **Cisco Systems**\- [Arjun Sambamoorthy](https://www.linkedin.com/in/arjun-sambamoorthy-b5861ab/) \- Sr. Director of AI

  - ​ _Securing MCP in an Agentic World_
- ​ **Cloudflare** \- [Dina Kozlov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dina-kozlov/) \- Sr. Product Manager

  - ​ _Building and Deploying Remote MCP Servers_
- ​ **Dagger** \- [Solomon Hykes](https://www.linkedin.com/in/solomonhykes/) \- Co-Founder

  - ​ _Typed Composition with MCP_

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception

speaker_insight: Antje Barth is a Principal Developer Advocate at Amazon Web Services (AWS). She focuses on serverless technologies, including AWS Lambda, and helps developers understand and adopt cloud-native architectures. Prior to AWS, she worked in various roles in software development and architecture. She is involved in the serverless community and frequently speaks at conferences and meetups. Her experience spans a broad range of topics, including application development, DevOps, and cloud computing.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​8:00 - 9:00 - Registration and Breakfast

- ​9:00 - 10:45 - Session One

- ​10:45 - 11:00 - Morning Break

- ​11:00 - 12:30 - Session Two

- ​12:30 - 1:15 - Lunch

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception


​

speaker_insight: Sambhav Kothari is an Engineering Manager and Head of AI Productivity at Bloomberg. He previously held roles as a Tech Lead and Senior Software Engineer at the same company. His work focuses on improving developer productivity through AI-powered tools. He has experience in areas such as large language models, machine learning, and software engineering. He is based in New York City.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​8:00 - 9:00 - Registration and Breakfast

- ​9:00 - 10:45 - Session One

- ​10:45 - 11:00 - Morning Break

- ​11:00 - 12:30 - Session Two

- ​12:30 - 1:15 - Lunch

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception


​

speaker_insight: Solomon Hykes is a French entrepreneur and software engineer. He is best known as the founder of Docker, a popular containerization platform. After stepping down as CTO of Docker in 2018, he co-founded Dagger, a programmable CI/CD platform. His work focuses on improving developer workflows and the software supply chain. Dagger aims to provide a unified and portable pipeline solution for building and deploying applications.

speaker_insight: Kent C. Dodds is a software developer, educator, and speaker. He is known for his work in the JavaScript and React ecosystems. He is the creator of EpicReact.Dev and EpicWeb.Dev, online platforms that provide comprehensive training for web developers. He focuses on teaching best practices for building robust and maintainable web applications. He is also a prolific open-source contributor and advocate for testing.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception

speaker_insight:
**

Aaron Parecki is the Director of Identity Standards at Okta. He is a web security expert and open source enthusiast. He focuses on identity protocols and standards, including OAuth, OpenID Connect, and WebAuthn. He is also a member of the MCP Steering Committee. His work involves contributing to and promoting secure and interoperable identity solutions.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception

speaker_insight:
**
Brenden Lane is currently a Senior Director of Developer Product at PayPal. He has a background in leading product strategy and execution for developer-focused products. Previously, he was at Braintree, which was acquired by PayPal. Brenden has experience in API design, platform strategy, and developer experience. He is focused on improving the experience for developers building on the PayPal platform.

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**

Nitin Sharma is a Principal MTS (Member of Technical Staff) in AI Research at PayPal. He specializes in machine learning and artificial intelligence applications. According to his LinkedIn profile, he has a background in building and deploying AI solutions for financial services. His work at PayPal likely involves research and development of AI-powered features for fraud detection, risk management, or customer experience. He previously worked at Samsung Research and holds a PhD from University of California, Riverside.

speaker_insight:
**
Tadas Antanavicius is the Co-Founder of PulseMCP, a company focused on IT solutions and services. He is also a member of the MCP Steering Committee. Tadas has a background in IT and business development. Based in Vilnius, Lithuania, he contributes to PulseMCP's growth and strategic direction. His LinkedIn profile highlights his expertise in cloud services, infrastructure, and cybersecurity.

# MCP Developers Summit

Hosted by MCP Summit

May

23

Friday, May 23

8:00 AM - 6:00 PM PDT

[Convene 100 Stockton\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Convene%20100%20Stockton&query_place_id=ChIJi10kuIiAhYARRHkGXE8xNNU)

Registration Closed

This event is not currently taking registrations. You may contact the host or subscribe to receive updates.

About Event

​MCP Developers Summit is SOLD OUT! If you have questions about the event - please email info@mcpsummit.ai

​\-\-\-------------------------------------------------

In less than a year, the MCP project has quickly reshaped how developers are building AI agents, introducing a critical layer of standardization, and a blueprint for how LLMs can interface with applications and tools. The MCP Dev Summit will bring together MCP co-founders and contributors working on the future of MCP project with developers using it to build the next generation of AI agents.

​Over the course of the day, we will cover topics including the MCP roadmap, security and identity, MCP orchestration and management, observability, MCP registries, as well as how developers are adopting the protocol and building it into their applications.

​​Join us in San Francisco on May 23. Unfortunately, capacity is limited to 300 people. Registration fee is $275 - click below to snag a spot.

​We'd like to thank our sponsors Amazon Web Services and Cisco, whose generous support has made the event possible.

**AGENDA AT-A-GLANCE**

_For the full agenda including session titles, speakers, and times please visit_ _[mcpdevsummit.ai](https://mcpdevsummit.ai/)_ _._

- ​8:00 - 9:00 - Registration and Breakfast

- ​9:00 - 10:45 - Session One

- ​10:45 - 11:00 - Morning Break

- ​11:00 - 12:30 - Session Two

- ​12:30 - 1:15 - Lunch

- ​1:15 - 2:45 - Session Three

- ​2:45 - 3:00 - Afternoon Break

- ​3:00 - 4:30 - Session Four

- ​4:30 - 6:00 - Reception


​

# Cofounder Matching: Finding the Right Partner

[EchoHer Events](https://lu.ma/echoher?k=c)

May

23

Friday, May 23

5:30 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Welcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Thinking about finding a cofounder — or not sure if you even need one? 🤔

Join us for a practical, honest workshop designed for early-stage founders facing one of the biggest startup decisions: building the right team.

​We’ll dive into:

- ​How to know if you need a cofounder

- ​What makes a strong cofounder match

- ​Red flags, founder breakups, and lessons learned

- ​Real stories from EchoHer founders


​This will be the real talk, tactical tips, and a chance to meet others who are building too. We'll also host a **cofounder speed dating** session during the event — a fun, low-pressure way to meet potential partners face-to-face.

​ **Looking for a cofounder?**

**👉** Fill out this short form [https://forms.gle/aXstZEabm8HSZpjTA](https://forms.gle/aXstZEabm8HSZpjTA). We’ll share everyone's info with the group after the event to help you stay connected.

​💛 Your ticket helps cover drinks, refreshments, and support future gatherings!

# ​Host

​ **[Dar Patel](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darpatel/overlay/about-this-profile/)** **,** Founder & Executive Coach of **Little Pursuits**

​ [​Little Pursuits](https://littlepursuits.life/) is a coaching firm focused on supporting founders as they navigate the unique challenges of building and scaling early-stage startups.

​ [​Dar Patel](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darpatel/) brings 15+ years of experience in consulting and tech, blending psychology and neuroscience to help founders and leaders to align their actions towards critical goals. Currently working with founders who are building companies from fintech to healthtech to edtech companies.

​ [Bing Li](https://www.linkedin.com/in/biing/), Startup Mentor & Advocate

​Bing is passionate about technology, disruptive innovation, and supporting founders at the earliest stages. She established and led the startup ecosystem at Agora, the global leading RTE (Real-Time Engagement) platform, mentored founders, curated global real-time AI showcases, and partnered with VCs and hackathons to drive innovation. Before that, she managed startup programs at Berkeley SkyDeck, helping founders grow and secure funding.

​As a former founder herself, Bing brings a unique blend of technical expertise, creative thinking, and real-world experience to help early-stage teams move faster with clarity and momentum. She is currently building [leavenlab.xyz](https://leavenlab.xyz/).

​​ [Qianwen](https://www.linkedin.com/in/qianwenchen/), CEO of EchoHer \| Lead Developer of Owls Head

​​ [​​​EchoHer](https://bio.site/echoher) is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women and non-binary founders and funders by increasing their representation and success in entrepreneurship. We foster a supportive ecosystem to drive meaningful change and create impactful opportunities through monthly events, co-working opportunities, curated networking sessions, pitch nights, and insightful panel discussions.​​​

Become an EchoHer contributing member today by donating $100, and help us continue providing invaluable resources and support to women founders. **[Learn more here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hbePuwxCrdFDMvBCGsosLXLp5Zm-qGg1hNGwKy8ItoE/edit?usp=sharing)**

May

23

Friday, May 23

5:30 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Welcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Thinking about finding a cofounder — or not sure if you even need one? 🤔

Join us for a practical, honest workshop designed for early-stage founders facing one of the biggest startup decisions: building the right team.

​We’ll dive into:

- ​How to know if you need a cofounder

- ​What makes a strong cofounder match

- ​Red flags, founder breakups, and lessons learned

- ​Real stories from EchoHer founders


​This will be the real talk, tactical tips, and a chance to meet others who are building too. We'll also host a **cofounder speed dating** session during the event — a fun, low-pressure way to meet potential partners face-to-face.

​ **Looking for a cofounder?**

**👉** Fill out this short form [https://forms.gle/aXstZEabm8HSZpjTA](https://forms.gle/aXstZEabm8HSZpjTA). We’ll share everyone's info with the group after the event to help you stay connected.

​💛 Your ticket helps cover drinks, refreshments, and support future gatherings!

# ​Host

​ **[Dar Patel](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darpatel/overlay/about-this-profile/)** **,** Founder & Executive Coach of **Little Pursuits**

​ [​Little Pursuits](https://littlepursuits.life/) is a coaching firm focused on supporting founders as they navigate the unique challenges of building and scaling early-stage startups.

​ [​Dar Patel](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darpatel/) brings 15+ years of experience in consulting and tech, blending psychology and neuroscience to help founders and leaders to align their actions towards critical goals. Currently working with founders who are building companies from fintech to healthtech to edtech companies.

​ [Bing Li](https://www.linkedin.com/in/biing/), Startup Mentor & Advocate

​Bing is passionate about technology, disruptive innovation, and supporting founders at the earliest stages. She established and led the startup ecosystem at Agora, the global leading RTE (Real-Time Engagement) platform, mentored founders, curated global real-time AI showcases, and partnered with VCs and hackathons to drive innovation. Before that, she managed startup programs at Berkeley SkyDeck, helping founders grow and secure funding.

​As a former founder herself, Bing brings a unique blend of technical expertise, creative thinking, and real-world experience to help early-stage teams move faster with clarity and momentum. She is currently building [leavenlab.xyz](https://leavenlab.xyz/).

​​ [Qianwen](https://www.linkedin.com/in/qianwenchen/), CEO of EchoHer \| Lead Developer of Owls Head

​​ [​​​EchoHer](https://bio.site/echoher) is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women and non-binary founders and funders by increasing their representation and success in entrepreneurship. We foster a supportive ecosystem to drive meaningful change and create impactful opportunities through monthly events, co-working opportunities, curated networking sessions, pitch nights, and insightful panel discussions.​​​

Become an EchoHer contributing member today by donating $100, and help us continue providing invaluable resources and support to women founders. **[Learn more here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hbePuwxCrdFDMvBCGsosLXLp5Zm-qGg1hNGwKy8ItoE/edit?usp=sharing)**

# \[2025\] Stanford d.school Design for Extended Realities Expo

Hosted by Sarah Chung & 3 others

Jun

6

Friday, June 6

5:30 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[Hasso Plattner Institute of Design\\
\\
Stanford, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Hasso%20Plattner%20Institute%20of%20Design&query_place_id=ChIJM0FT8Na6j4ARjxDDc4dt4SE)

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​DESIGN284: Design for Extended Realities is having its inaugural public exposition event this June! Come join us at the **Stanford** **[d.school](http://d.school/)** **in the Atrium**. Food and drinks provided.

[DESIGN284](https://dschool.stanford.edu/classes/designing-for-extended-realitites) is a quarter-long, project-based class focusing on developing emerging technology use cases in XR. Our diverse cohort of students — from business, design, computer science, and education — have spent the quarter conducting human-centered design research around problem areas and prototyping in XR with devices such as Snap Spectacles and Meta Quest 3.

​In this event, groups will be demonstrating and pitching their human-centered use cases and solutions. This will be an immersive and experiential time. Please try to arrive on time!

​This blend of computer science, design, and entrepreneurship is enriched by a 10-week learning journey with industry leaders and advisors at IDEO, Snap, Meta, Unity, and more.

​XR industry practitioners, investors and judges will be in present. We look forward to seeing you there!

​

​Design for Extended Realities Teaching Team,

​YC, Payam, Sarah, Ari

​

​Agenda

​5:30 - 6:00: Food, drinks, and mingling

​6:00 - 6:30: Intro and project pitches

​6:30 - 8:30: Exploring project booths

​8:30 - 9:00: Judging and closing ceremony

Location

Hasso Plattner Institute of Design

416 Escondido Mall #550, Stanford, CA 94305, USA

Downstairs in the Atrium

speaker_insight:
**
Sarah Chung is a Design Facilitator and Host at the Stanford d.school, specializing in creative skill-building. She has experience in designing and facilitating engaging learning experiences for diverse audiences. She focuses on human-centered design and its application in various contexts. Her work revolves around fostering creativity, collaboration, and problem-solving skills through design thinking methodologies. Prior to the d.school, she worked in other roles that focused on developing innovative strategies and solutions.

About Event

​DESIGN284: Design for Extended Realities is having its inaugural public exposition event this June! Come join us at the **Stanford** **[d.school](http://d.school/)** **in the Atrium**. Food and drinks provided.

[DESIGN284](https://dschool.stanford.edu/classes/designing-for-extended-realitites) is a quarter-long, project-based class focusing on developing emerging technology use cases in XR. Our diverse cohort of students — from business, design, computer science, and education — have spent the quarter conducting human-centered design research around problem areas and prototyping in XR with devices such as Snap Spectacles and Meta Quest 3.

​In this event, groups will be demonstrating and pitching their human-centered use cases and solutions. This will be an immersive and experiential time. Please try to arrive on time!

​This blend of computer science, design, and entrepreneurship is enriched by a 10-week learning journey with industry leaders and advisors at IDEO, Snap, Meta, Unity, and more.

​XR industry practitioners, investors and judges will be in present. We look forward to seeing you there!

# 🧠 The Thought Experiment Lab \[public\]

Hosted by Mendel Liu & The SF Commons

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

6:30 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

[550 Laguna St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=550%20Laguna%20St&query_place_id=ChIJQ9xlT6KAhYAReQIfVQZP4ds)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Note: while there are many guests listed in the RSVP, most of these are carried over from previous events in this series. We don't expect much more than 30 to attend.

"Imagination without reason is mere fancy, but reason without imagination is sterile. That is partly why scientists and philosophers alike have always used imaginary scenarios to help sharpen their ideas and push them to their limits." - _The Pig that Wants to be Eaten_, by Julian Baggini

For this meeting (May 21), we'll be discussing skepticism and whether we can know if we are brains in a vat, living in a simulation, being deceived by an all-powerful demon, etc.

- ​We'll take some time at the meeting to read about GE Moore's argument against skepticism: [https://www.lse.ac.uk/philosophy/blog/2020/09/29/g-e-moores-hands-vs-radical-scepticism/](https://www.lse.ac.uk/philosophy/blog/2020/09/29/g-e-moores-hands-vs-radical-scepticism/)

- ​And also this primer on philosophical discourse: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Gj3HesfWz4A2kEAMSY0x7hNxvJZNtiCexUeilJXVak8/edit?tab=t.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Gj3HesfWz4A2kEAMSY0x7hNxvJZNtiCexUeilJXVak8/edit?tab=t.0)

- ​It is highly recommended to also read this short article beforehand: [https://spot.colorado.edu/~huemer/V.htm](https://spot.colorado.edu/~huemer/V.htm)


​Some examples of things we've discussed at past meetings:

- ​Could a vegetarian eat a pig with a clear conscience, if that pig wanted to be eaten?

- ​Does a person survive using a teleporter that destroys the body and recreates it with perfect fidelity?

- ​Does the existence of evil in the world pose a problem for belief in a benevolent God?


​We'll be meeting in the 550 Room (down the stairs on the North side). Contact me by text if you're having trouble finding the location.

​On the Wednesdays when we're not running this event, we'll often be having similar discussions here: [https://lu.ma/shortstories](https://lu.ma/shortstories)

event_name: Graph Exchange May 2025: AI Agents and Knowledge Graphs
event_summary: Graph Exchange is an innovative mini-conference on Graph-powered AI Agents, Knowledge Graphs, GraphRAG, and all ways where graphs underpin the modern GenAI stack. Brought to you by Neo4j, the category-defining graph database, we’ll review key use cases for graphs and bring together the leading graph experts.
speaker_details: Nikita Ivanov is a hands-on technology executive with over 25 years of experience. Product leader with extensive experience in developing new HPC data management and GenAI/LLM/Agentic products, raising capital, and nurturing PLG throughout all stages of the business. Founder/CEO of GridGain Systems, DataLingvo and Humatron AI. Advisor to multiple AI startups, frequent international speaker and Forbes Technology Council member, active open source contributor, and Java/Scala founding community member. Francisco Ferreira founded DataLinks after nine years at Palantir, solving complex data challenges across various industries. He's now focused on bringing the world's data together by automatically building graphs that serve as a foundational data layer for enterprises in the era of AI agents. Rishi Puri graduated from UC Berkeley and is a lead engineer for the Deep Learning FrameWork PyG at NVIDIA. He is also a core contributor to the open source PyG framework and community. His main focus is researching how to combine state of the art graph and language modeling techniques. He enjoys teaching about this work at Stanford, conferences, webinars, and through the PyG Slack and LinkedIn communities.

# Graph Exchange May 2025: AI Agents and Knowledge Graphs

[Neo4j](https://lu.ma/neo4j?k=c)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

4:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[717 Market St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=717%20Market%20St&query_place_id=ChIJhZ74MY-AhYARscx5mk67G-w)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Graph Exchange is an innovative mini-conference on Graph-powered AI Agents, Knowledge Graphs, GraphRAG, and all ways where graphs underpin the modern GenAI stack.  Brought to you by Neo4j, the category-defining graph database, we’ll review key use cases for graphs and bring together the leading graph experts.

​Join us at the iconic San Francisco hub for half a day on May 21!

​Doors open at 4:00 pm.

​We start with technical talks on the core concepts:

- ​Graphs and MCP Servers

- ​Knowledge Graphs in industry, from construction to GraphRAG

- ​Agentic ASI with Graphs

- ​Global data infrastructre for AI


​The talks will be followed by a panel setting topics for community discussion and work.  After breakout sessions we’ll reconvene for the final panel, reviewing the best practices for a complete end to end OSS AI Knowledge Stack.

​For the breakout sessions 6:30-8pm, we plan to run an unconference setup. There will be two general topics

​— Agentic AI Memory (AI storage)

— Agentic Graph Reasoning (AI compute)

Please sign up to give \[ [lightning talks here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12xtQYOYGmDPsV6iooI_XMpfi_DYMBai0juplAtD9Sbw/edit?usp=sharing)\].

- ​


​Agenda:

​Doors open 4:00 pm

​4:00 pm - 4:40 pm: Networking

​4:40 pm - 5:00 pm: **Alexy Khrabrov, Neo4j**

​Grand Wecome

Open Agentic AI Knowledge Stack introduction

​5:00 pm - 5:20 pm: **Nikita Ivanov, Humatron**

​ **From Agentic RPA to Self-Leaning Autonomous Agents**

​Discussion around the ongoing active transition from the initial agentic architecture with hardcoded agentic workflows (RPA) to reasoning LLMs, MCP, recursive self-learning and autonomous working.

​Nikita Ivanov is a hands-on technology executive with over 25 years of experience. Product leader with extensive experience in developing new HPC data management and GenAI/LLM/Agentic products, raising capital, and nurturing PLG throughout all stages of the business. Founder/CEO of GridGain Systems, DataLingvo and Humatron AI. Advisor to multiple AI startups, frequent international speaker and Forbes Technology Council member, active open source contributor, and Java/Scala founding community member.

​5:20 pm - 5:40 pm: **Francisco Ferreira, DataLinks**

​ **Tabular Graphs**

​Let's chat about how AI agents can use automated graphs as their user experience layer to collaborate, where this lives in their agentic workflows, and what types of Agents are surfacing in today's enterprises. Let's also explore how to make Knowledge Graphs and Ontologies become the shared memory layer that allows for humans and AIs to work together!

​Francisco Ferreira founded DataLinks after nine years at Palantir, solving complex data challenges across various industries. He's now focused on bringing the world's data together by automatically building graphs that serve as a foundational data layer for enterprises in the era of AI agents.

​5:40 pm - 6:00 pm **Jure Leskovec, Stanford & Kumo**

​Foundation Models for Graph Learning

​6:00 pm - 6:20 pm **Rishi Puri, NVIDIA**

​ **GNNs & LLMs in PyG**

​This talk will cover how Graph Neural Networks can be used to enhance LLMs using PyG to improve accuracy for RAG like tasks across any kind of data domain. This will include examples on real world data. We will also cover how LLMs can be used to enhance GNNs for graph machine learning tasks.

​Rishi Puri graduated from UC Berkeley and is a lead engineer for the Deep Learning FrameWork PyG at NVIDIA. He is also a core contributor to the open source PyG framework and community. His main focus is researching how to combine state of the art graph and language modeling techniques. He enjoys teaching about this work at Stanford, conferences, webinars, and through the PyG Slack and LinkedIn communities.

​6:30 pm - 8:00 pm: Breakout Sessions

​We'll add talks and sessions on the topics below.

- ​MCP/A2A

- ​AI Memory

- ​GraphRAG


​8:00 pm - 8:45 pm: **Panel and plenary discussion**

​Leaders of breakout sessions join the panel and summarize their findings for the best ways to build AI applications.

​9:00 pm: closing

Don't forget to add the event to your calendar! See you soon!

# Graph Exchange May 2025: AI Agents and Knowledge Graphs

[Neo4j](https://lu.ma/neo4j?k=c)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

4:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[717 Market St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=717%20Market%20St&query_place_id=ChIJhZ74MY-AhYARscx5mk67G-w)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Graph Exchange is an innovative mini-conference on Graph-powered AI Agents, Knowledge Graphs, GraphRAG, and all ways where graphs underpin the modern GenAI stack.  Brought to you by Neo4j, the category-defining graph database, we’ll review key use cases for graphs and bring together the leading graph experts.

​Join us at the iconic San Francisco hub for half a day on May 21!

​Doors open at 4:00 pm.

​We start with technical talks on the core concepts:

- ​Graphs and MCP Servers

- ​Knowledge Graphs in industry, from construction to GraphRAG

- ​Agentic ASI with Graphs

- ​Global data infrastructre for AI


​The talks will be followed by a panel setting topics for community discussion and work.  After breakout sessions we’ll reconvene for the final panel, reviewing the best practices for a complete end to end OSS AI Knowledge Stack.

​For the breakout sessions 6:30-8pm, we plan to run an unconference setup. There will be two general topics

​— Agentic AI Memory (AI storage)

— Agentic Graph Reasoning (AI compute)

Please sign up to give \[ [lightning talks here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12xtQYOYGmDPsV6iooI_XMpfi_DYMBai0juplAtD9Sbw/edit?usp=sharing)\].

- ​


​Agenda:

​Doors open 4:00 pm

​4:00 pm - 4:40 pm: Networking

​4:40 pm - 5:00 pm: **Alexy Khrabrov, Neo4j**

​Grand Wecome

Open Agentic AI Knowledge Stack introduction

​5:00 pm - 5:20 pm: **Nikita Ivanov, Humatron**

​ **From Agentic RPA to Self-Leaning Autonomous Agents**

​Discussion around the ongoing active transition from the initial agentic architecture with hardcoded agentic workflows (RPA) to reasoning LLMs, MCP, recursive self-learning and autonomous working.

​Nikita Ivanov is a hands-on technology executive with over 25 years of experience. Product leader with extensive experience in developing new HPC data management and GenAI/LLM/Agentic products, raising capital, and nurturing PLG throughout all stages of the business. Founder/CEO of GridGain Systems, DataLingvo and Humatron AI. Advisor to multiple AI startups, frequent international speaker and Forbes Technology Council member, active open source contributor, and Java/Scala founding community member.

​5:20 pm - 5:40 pm: **Francisco Ferreira, DataLinks**

​ **Tabular Graphs**

​Let's chat about how AI agents can use automated graphs as their user experience layer to collaborate, where this lives in their agentic workflows, and what types of Agents are surfacing in today's enterprises. Let's also explore how to make Knowledge Graphs and Ontologies become the shared memory layer that allows for humans and AIs to work together!

​Francisco Ferreira founded DataLinks after nine years at Palantir, solving complex data challenges across various industries. He's now focused on bringing the world's data together by automatically building graphs that serve as a foundational data layer for enterprises in the era of AI agents.

​5:40 pm - 6:00 pm **Jure Leskovec, Stanford & Kumo**

​Foundation Models for Graph Learning

​6:00 pm - 6:20 pm **Rishi Puri, NVIDIA**

​ **GNNs & LLMs in PyG**

​This talk will cover how Graph Neural Networks can be used to enhance LLMs using PyG to improve accuracy for RAG like tasks across any kind of data domain. This will include examples on real world data. We will also cover how LLMs can be used to enhance GNNs for graph machine learning tasks.

​Rishi Puri graduated from UC Berkeley and is a lead engineer for the Deep Learning FrameWork PyG at NVIDIA. He is also a core contributor to the open source PyG framework and community. His main focus is researching how to combine state of the art graph and language modeling techniques. He enjoys teaching about this work at Stanford, conferences, webinars, and through the PyG Slack and LinkedIn communities.

​6:30 pm - 8:00 pm: Breakout Sessions

​We'll add talks and sessions on the topics below.

- ​MCP/A2A

- ​AI Memory

- ​GraphRAG


​8:00 pm - 8:45 pm: **Panel and plenary discussion**

​Leaders of breakout sessions join the panel and summarize their findings for the best ways to build AI applications.

​9:00 pm: closing

Don't forget to add the event to your calendar! See you soon!

Location

717 Market St

San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

speaker_insight:
**
Jure Leskovec is a Stanford University professor specializing in network analysis, data mining, and machine learning. His research focuses on understanding large social and information networks, their evolution, and their impact on society. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University. He is also the chief scientist at Kumo. Leskovec has received numerous awards for his research contributions. His work spans areas like web search, recommender systems, and online advertising.

# Graph Exchange May 2025: AI Agents and Knowledge Graphs

[Neo4j](https://lu.ma/neo4j?k=c)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

4:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[717 Market St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=717%20Market%20St&query_place_id=ChIJhZ74MY-AhYARscx5mk67G-w)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Graph Exchange is an innovative mini-conference on Graph-powered AI Agents, Knowledge Graphs, GraphRAG, and all ways where graphs underpin the modern GenAI stack.  Brought to you by Neo4j, the category-defining graph database, we’ll review key use cases for graphs and bring together the leading graph experts.

​Join us at the iconic San Francisco hub for half a day on May 21!

​Doors open at 4:00 pm.

​We start with technical talks on the core concepts:

- ​Graphs and MCP Servers

- ​Knowledge Graphs in industry, from construction to GraphRAG

- ​Agentic ASI with Graphs

- ​Global data infrastructre for AI


​The talks will be followed by a panel setting topics for community discussion and work.  After breakout sessions we’ll reconvene for the final panel, reviewing the best practices for a complete end to end OSS AI Knowledge Stack.

​For the breakout sessions 6:30-8pm, we plan to run an unconference setup. There will be two general topics

​— Agentic AI Memory (AI storage)

— Agentic Graph Reasoning (AI compute)

Please sign up to give \[ [lightning talks here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12xtQYOYGmDPsV6iooI_XMpfi_DYMBai0juplAtD9Sbw/edit?usp=sharing)\].

- ​


​Agenda:

​Doors open 4:00 pm

​4:00 pm - 4:40 pm: Networking

​4:40 pm - 5:00 pm: **Alexy Khrabrov, Neo4j**

​Grand Wecome

Open Agentic AI Knowledge Stack introduction

​5:00 pm - 5:20 pm: **Nikita Ivanov, Humatron**

​ **From Agentic RPA to Self-Leaning Autonomous Agents**

​Discussion around the ongoing active transition from the initial agentic architecture with hardcoded agentic workflows (RPA) to reasoning LLMs, MCP, recursive self-learning and autonomous working.

​Nikita Ivanov is a hands-on technology executive with over 25 years of experience. Product leader with extensive experience in developing new HPC data management and GenAI/LLM/Agentic products, raising capital, and nurturing PLG throughout all stages of the business. Founder/CEO of GridGain Systems, DataLingvo and Humatron AI. Advisor to multiple AI startups, frequent international speaker and Forbes Technology Council member, active open source contributor, and Java/Scala founding community member.

​5:20 pm - 5:40 pm: **Francisco Ferreira, DataLinks**

​ **Tabular Graphs**

​Let's chat about how AI agents can use automated graphs as their user experience layer to collaborate, where this lives in their agentic workflows, and what types of Agents are surfacing in today's enterprises. Let's also explore how to make Knowledge Graphs and Ontologies become the shared memory layer that allows for humans and AIs to work together!

​Francisco Ferreira founded DataLinks after nine years at Palantir, solving complex data challenges across various industries. He's now focused on bringing the world's data together by automatically building graphs that serve as a foundational data layer for enterprises in the era of AI agents.

​5:40 pm - 6:00 pm **Jure Leskovec, Stanford & Kumo**

​Foundation Models for Graph Learning

​6:00 pm - 6:20 pm **Rishi Puri, NVIDIA**

​ **GNNs & LLMs in PyG**

​This talk will cover how Graph Neural Networks can be used to enhance LLMs using PyG to improve accuracy for RAG like tasks across any kind of data domain. This will include examples on real world data. We will also cover how LLMs can be used to enhance GNNs for graph machine learning tasks.

​Rishi Puri graduated from UC Berkeley and is a lead engineer for the Deep Learning FrameWork PyG at NVIDIA. He is also a core contributor to the open source PyG framework and community. His main focus is researching how to combine state of the art graph and language modeling techniques. He enjoys teaching about this work at Stanford, conferences, webinars, and through the PyG Slack and LinkedIn communities.

​6:30 pm - 8:00 pm: Breakout Sessions

​We'll add talks and sessions on the topics below.

- ​MCP/A2A

- ​AI Memory

- ​GraphRAG


​8:00 pm - 8:45 pm: **Panel and plenary discussion**

​Leaders of breakout sessions join the panel and summarize their findings for the best ways to build AI applications.

​9:00 pm: closing

Don't forget to add the event to your calendar! See you soon!

event_summary: Running a business is exhausting... but you don’t have to do it alone. Solo entrepreneurs in various fields are invited to connect and share experiences, hear from Coach John about his journey in the fitness industry, and discuss common challenges faced by solopreneurs.
event_location: Avalon Morrison Park, San Jose, California
speaker_details: Coach John has over 12 years of experience in the fitness industry and has built a thriving personal training business from the ground up. He’ll share his story and journey – the wins, the struggles, and the systems that helped him scale without burning out.
speaker_insight:
**
John Calipari is an American basketball coach. He is currently the head men's basketball coach at the University of Arkansas. He previously served as the head coach at UMass, Memphis, and Kentucky. Calipari is known for his recruiting abilities and developing players for the NBA. He led Kentucky to a national championship in 2012. Throughout his career, he has been recognized as one of the top coaches in college basketball.
