# Fireside Chat: AI Agent + Growth - Scaling from $0 to $15M ARR with Team 9

[FounderCoHo](https://lu.ma/foundercoho?k=c)

May

22

Thursday, May 22

6:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[1580 Drake Way\\
\\
Palo Alto, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=1580%20Drake%20Way&query_place_id=ChIJmwL6e-q6j4ARnoUnSc6Wx0w)

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Ticket Price

$35.00

Welcome! To join the event, please get your ticket below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Join us for an exclusive evening with founders who have successfully **scaled AI agent consumer products from zero to millions in ARR**.

## ​ **📈 Event Description**

​How do you build and scale an AI consumer product in today's competitive landscape? What are the non-obvious growth levers that can take you from **$1M to $3M ARR in just 4 months**, or **from $800K to $15M ARR with a team of just 9 people**?

​This intimate gathering brings together founders and operators who have done exactly that. Come learn about practical, tactical approaches to **acquisition, activation, conversion, and retention** that have driven real business results.

## ​ **🎤 Featured Speakers**

​ **[Coco Mao](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kechunmao/)** **\-** CEO & Co-Founder at [OpenArt](https://www.linkedin.com/company/openart-ai/)

✨ _From $800K to $15M ARR with a team of 9 in 10 months_ ✨

​ **[YJ Guo](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yj-guo-300262106/)** **\-** CGO at [Mathos AI](https://www.linkedin.com/company/mathosai/)

✨ _Scaled to 1.5M MAU and $1M+ ARR in just 6 months with zero paid ads_

​ **[Aditya Bhatia](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adityabhatia18/)** Growth at [Toolhouse](https://www.linkedin.com/company/toolhouseai/) \| Serial Founder \| Forbes 30 Under 30

✨ _Author of "The Virality Playbook"_

​🎙️ Moderated by **[Nancy Zheng](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nanzheng/)**, Co-Founder of [Hachi AI](https://www.linkedin.com/company/hachi-ai/)

## ​ **💡 What You'll Learn**

​ **🌎 Customer Acquisition:**

- ​How to scale to **millions ARR** with **zero paid ads** through focused growth strategies

- ​Why focusing on a **single growth channel** is crucial for early-stage startups


​ **🔥 Conversion:**

- ​The psychology of trial credits and why " **less is more**" for conversion rate

- ​How a simple 3-day engineering project **boosted conversions by 30%**


​ **🗓 Retention:**

- ​Community-building tactics that drive **free retention** using Discord and student ambassadors

- ​Why yearly subscriptions are key to finding and retaining **power users**


​ **👥 Team Building:**

- ​The " **burnout first**" approach to hiring that ensures every role is truly necessary

- ​When to hire, when to fire, and how to build a **lean, high-performing team**


## ​​​​ **_Event Schedule:_**

- ​​​​ _6:00 PM - 6:30 PM: Welcome and Networking_

- ​​​​ _6:30 PM - 7:20 PM: Panel and Q&A_

- ​​​​ _7:20 PM onwards: Socializing, and Continued Conversations_


​​​🗓️ **Event Details:** 🗓️

- ​​​ **Date:** May 22nd, 2024(Thursday)

- ​​​ **Time:** 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM ⏰

- ​​​ **Location:** Stanford 📍

- ​​​​​ **_Ticket Price:_** _$35 (Includes dinner and drinks) 🍽️🥂_


​​​ **_RSVP:_** _Limited spots are available! 🏃‍♀️_

​​​​​ _We look forward to welcoming you to this unforgettable evening of connection and inspiration! 🎉_

​​​​​ **_Important Note:_** _Space is limited for this intimate gathering. While we may not be able to accommodate everyone this time, we encourage you to RSVP soon! We truly appreciate your interest and look forward to welcoming you at a future event._

​​​​​ **Spotlight Opportunity**

​​​We’re offering a special presentation opportunity for attendees to introduce themselves or their company in 1-2 minutes. If you’re interested, please contact us at crew@foundercoho.com. Spots are limited, but if you don’t make it this time, we’ll prioritize you for future events.

​

# ​​ **Our Partner**

​ [​Novita AI](https://novita.ai/) is a San Francisco–based AI infrastructure company that makes high-performance model inference accessible to developers and enterprises. Our cloud platform offers both serverless and dedicated GPU instances, simple APIs, and pay-as-you-go billing—so teams can deploy, scale, and optimize open-source LLMs without managing complex infrastructure. By focusing on cost efficiency, reliability, and ease of use, Novita AI lets you build AI-powered applications faster.

# ​​​​​ **Meet your Host!**

​​​​​ [FounderCoHo](http://www.foundercoho.com/) is a community where founders support each other by sharing knowledge and building connections. Starting a company is a brave endeavor. Many of us have faced numerous challenges and learned valuable lessons along the way. The founder's journey can feel lonely, as it's difficult to discuss its nuances with those who haven't experienced it firsthand. FounderCoho aims to be that supportive community where founders can share their stories and get fueled for their company-building journey.

​​​​Where to find us:

​​​​ [LinkedIn](http://linkedin.com/company/foundercoho)

​​​ [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/@FounderCoHo)

# Fireside Chat: AI Agent + Growth - Scaling from $0 to $15M ARR with Team 9

[FounderCoHo](https://lu.ma/foundercoho?k=c)

May

22

Thursday, May 22

6:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[1580 Drake Way\\
\\
Palo Alto, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=1580%20Drake%20Way&query_place_id=ChIJmwL6e-q6j4ARnoUnSc6Wx0w)

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Ticket Price

$35.00

Welcome! To join the event, please get your ticket below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Join us for an exclusive evening with founders who have successfully **scaled AI agent consumer products from zero to millions in ARR**.

## ​ **📈 Event Description**

​How do you build and scale an AI consumer product in today's competitive landscape? What are the non-obvious growth levers that can take you from **$1M to $3M ARR in just 4 months**, or **from $800K to $15M ARR with a team of just 9 people**?

​This intimate gathering brings together founders and operators who have done exactly that. Come learn about practical, tactical approaches to **acquisition, activation, conversion, and retention** that have driven real business results.

## ​ **🎤 Featured Speakers**

​ **[Coco Mao](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kechunmao/)** **\-** CEO & Co-Founder at [OpenArt](https://www.linkedin.com/company/openart-ai/)

✨ _From $800K to $15M ARR with a team of 9 in 10 months_ ✨

​ **[YJ Guo](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yj-guo-300262106/)** **\-** CGO at [Mathos AI](https://www.linkedin.com/company/mathosai/)

✨ _Scaled to 1.5M MAU and $1M+ ARR in just 6 months with zero paid ads_

​ **[Aditya Bhatia](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adityabhatia18/)** Growth at [Toolhouse](https://www.linkedin.com/company/toolhouseai/) \| Serial Founder \| Forbes 30 Under 30

✨ _Author of "The Virality Playbook"_

​🎙️ Moderated by **[Nancy Zheng](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nanzheng/)**, Co-Founder of [Hachi AI](https://www.linkedin.com/company/hachi-ai/)

## ​ **💡 What You'll Learn**

​ **🌎 Customer Acquisition:**

- ​How to scale to **millions ARR** with **zero paid ads** through focused growth strategies

- ​Why focusing on a **single growth channel** is crucial for early-stage startups


​ **🔥 Conversion:**

- ​The psychology of trial credits and why " **less is more**" for conversion rate

- ​How a simple 3-day engineering project **boosted conversions by 30%**


​ **🗓 Retention:**

- ​Community-building tactics that drive **free retention** using Discord and student ambassadors

- ​Why yearly subscriptions are key to finding and retaining **power users**


​ **👥 Team Building:**

- ​The " **burnout first**" approach to hiring that ensures every role is truly necessary

- ​When to hire, when to fire, and how to build a **lean, high-performing team**


## ​​​​ **_Event Schedule:_**

- ​​​​ _6:00 PM - 6:30 PM: Welcome and Networking_

- ​​​​ _6:30 PM - 7:20 PM: Panel and Q&A_

- ​​​​ _7:20 PM onwards: Socializing, and Continued Conversations_


​​​🗓️ **Event Details:** 🗓️

- ​​​ **Date:** May 22nd, 2024(Thursday)

- ​​​ **Time:** 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM ⏰

- ​​​ **Location:** Stanford 📍

- ​​​​​ **_Ticket Price:_** _$35 (Includes dinner and drinks) 🍽️🥂_


​​​ **_RSVP:_** _Limited spots are available! 🏃‍♀️_

​​​​​ _We look forward to welcoming you to this unforgettable evening of connection and inspiration! 🎉_

​​​​​ **_Important Note:_** _Space is limited for this intimate gathering. While we may not be able to accommodate everyone this time, we encourage you to RSVP soon! We truly appreciate your interest and look forward to welcoming you at a future event._

​​​​​ **Spotlight Opportunity**

​​​We’re offering a special presentation opportunity for attendees to introduce themselves or their company in 1-2 minutes. If you’re interested, please contact us at crew@foundercoho.com. Spots are limited, but if you don’t make it this time, we’ll prioritize you for future events.

​

# ​​ **Our Partner**

​ [​Novita AI](https://novita.ai/) is a San Francisco–based AI infrastructure company that makes high-performance model inference accessible to developers and enterprises. Our cloud platform offers both serverless and dedicated GPU instances, simple APIs, and pay-as-you-go billing—so teams can deploy, scale, and optimize open-source LLMs without managing complex infrastructure. By focusing on cost efficiency, reliability, and ease of use, Novita AI lets you build AI-powered applications faster.

# ​​​​​ **Meet your Host!**

​​​​​ [FounderCoHo](http://www.foundercoho.com/) is a community where founders support each other by sharing knowledge and building connections. Starting a company is a brave endeavor. Many of us have faced numerous challenges and learned valuable lessons along the way. The founder's journey can feel lonely, as it's difficult to discuss its nuances with those who haven't experienced it firsthand. FounderCoho aims to be that supportive community where founders can share their stories and get fueled for their company-building journey.

​​​​Where to find us:

​​​​ [LinkedIn](http://linkedin.com/company/foundercoho)

​​​ [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/@FounderCoHo)

speaker_insight:
**
Aditya Bhatia is the Founder of Toolhouse, a company focused on scaling growth through product led growth and customer led growth. He has over a decade of experience in building and scaling product & growth teams. He advises and invests in early-stage startups. His expertise lies in product-led growth (PLG) strategies, SaaS business models, and customer-centric growth initiatives. He has a background in engineering and holds an MBA.

# First Block: From Zero to a Hundred (Million): The Cursor Story with Michael Truell, hosted by Notion

[Notion](https://lu.ma/calendar/cal-ZDQrtBgbNzSJZkh)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

5:30 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Event Full

If you’d like, you can join the waitlist.

Please click on the button below to join the waitlist. You will be notified if additional spots become available.

Join Waitlist

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​How do you build one of the fastest-growing AI startups in under a year?

​Join us in San Francisco for an exclusive, **invite-only taping of First Block** — Notion's founder-led series on what it really takes to build breakout companies from day one. We’ll be sitting down with **[Michael Truell, Co-Founder & CEO of Anysphere](https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-t-5b1bbb122/)**, the company behind **[Cursor](https://www.cursor.com/en)** \- the AI-native code editor developers can’t stop talking about!

​We’ll unpack Cursor’s founding journey, their early pivot, and the decisions that powered their rapid growth. Michael will share how his team is rethinking the future of software development in the age of AI - and what it means to build when machines can build too.

​🎙 Moderated by **[Lena Waters, CMO, Notion](https://www.linkedin.com/in/lenawaters/)** **.**

​This is an **invite-only in-person event in San Francisco**. Expect a packed room of top founders and builders, rooftop views, and light refreshments. Come for the conversation, stay for the community.

## ​ **Agenda**

​5:30 PM – Guest Arrival & Check-In \[please be on time\]

6:00 PM – Fireside Chat with Michael Truell + Audience Q&A

7:00 PM – Rooftop Networking & Light Refreshments

8:00 PM – Event Ends

_Watch previous episodes of_ _[First Block](https://www.notion.com/blog/topic/first-block)_ _with founders of Anthropic, Rippling, Webflow, Front, and more._

* * *

## ​ **About Notion**

​​Startups move fast. That's why thousands of startups all around the world choose to build on Notion. In one place, you can organize, plan, and execute - whether you're managing investor outreach, documenting key decisions, or scaling operations. **[Apply now to get up to 6 months of Notion’s Business plan with Notion AI included, a $12,000 value.](https://www.notion.com/startups?utm_medium=partner&utm_source=startup_partner&utm_campaign=startup-program-partner-firstblocklive&partner=First%20Block%20Live&partnerKey=STARTUP4110P03445)** Ship quickly, stay aligned, and scale efficiently in one connected AI workspace.

* * *

## ​ **About Cursor**

​Anysphere is a rapidly growing AI startup founded in 2022 by four MIT alumni: Michael Truell, Sualeh Asif, Arvid Lunnemark, and Aman Sanger. The company is best known for developing Cursor, an AI-powered code editor designed to enhance developer productivity by integrating advanced artificial intelligence features directly into the coding environment.

[Notion](https://lu.ma/calendar/cal-ZDQrtBgbNzSJZkh)

21

Register to See Address

About Event

​How do you build one of the fastest-growing AI startups in under a year?

​Join us in San Francisco for an exclusive, **invite-only taping of First Block** — Notion's founder-led series on what it really takes to build breakout companies from day one. We’ll be sitting down with **[Michael Truell, Co-Founder & CEO of Anysphere](https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-t-5b1bbb122/)**, the company behind **[Cursor](https://www.cursor.com/en)** \- the AI-native code editor developers can’t stop talking about!

​We’ll unpack Cursor’s founding journey, their early pivot, and the decisions that powered their rapid growth. Michael will share how his team is rethinking the future of software development in the age of AI - and what it means to build when machines can build too.

​🎙 Moderated by **[Lena Waters, CMO, Notion](https://www.linkedin.com/in/lenawaters/)** **.**

​This is an **invite-only in-person event in San Francisco**. Expect a packed room of top founders and builders, rooftop views, and light refreshments. Come for the conversation, stay for the community.

## ​ **Agenda**

​5:30 PM – Guest Arrival & Check-In \[please be on time\]

6:00 PM – Fireside Chat with Michael Truell + Audience Q&A

7:00 PM – Rooftop Networking & Light Refreshments

8:00 PM – Event Ends

_Watch previous episodes of_ _[First Block](https://www.notion.com/blog/topic/first-block)_ _with founders of Anthropic, Rippling, Webflow, Front, and more._

* * *

## ​ **About Notion**

​​Startups move fast. That's why thousands of startups all around the world choose to build on Notion. In one place, you can organize, plan, and execute - whether you're managing investor outreach, documenting key decisions, or scaling operations. **[Apply now to get up to 6 months of Notion’s Business plan with Notion AI included, a $12,000 value.](https://www.notion.com/startups?utm_medium=partner&utm_source=startup_partner&utm_campaign=startup-program-partner-firstblocklive&partner=First%20Block%20Live&partnerKey=STARTUP4110P03445)** Ship quickly, stay aligned, and scale efficiently in one connected AI workspace.

* * *

## ​ **About Cursor**

​Anysphere is a rapidly growing AI startup founded in 2022 by four MIT alumni: Michael Truell, Sualeh Asif, Arvid Lunnemark, and Aman Sanger. The company is best known for developing Cursor, an AI-powered code editor designed to enhance developer productivity by integrating advanced artificial intelligence features directly into the coding environment.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​ **[Hosted by HRC Fertility](https://www.havingbabies.com/locations/san-francisco/)**

​As conversations about fertility, AI, and education move from the clinic to Congress—and from the coasts into cultural mainstream—a new generation is asking: W _hat kind of future are we building, and for whom?_

​This panel brings together leaders from healthcare, tech, and education to explore how innovation is reshaping the landscape for parenthood.

​🎙 Featuring:

​ [Kay Waud](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kay-waud-85483b59/), MD, PhD, HRC Fertility Reproductive endocrinologist at HRC Fertility with an engineering background, focused on expanding access and education on fertility care

​ [Christina Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinaren1/), MS, CGC Genetic counselor specializing in translating complex genomic data and leading initiatives to make PGT testing more accessible

​ [Jasmine Su](https://x.com/jasminewsun) [n](https://jasmi.news/) is a writer and technologist exploring the cultural and political impact of disruptive technologies in the age of AGI and Silicon Valley

[Saachi Dhingra](https://www.linkedin.com/in/saachidhingra/) is the founder of [Sachi](https://gosachi.com/), a VC-backed startup connecting families with licensed PreK–12 educators for flexible, specialized childcare and learning. She’s spent over a decade bridging gaps between families and early education systems.

Moderated by [Livia Han](https://www.linkedin.com/in/livia-han-842802137/), a women's health advocate

* * *

## ​ **Discussion Topics Will Include**

- ​Breakthroughs in fertility care, including AI-guided diagnostics and next-gen embryo selection tools

- ​How access to technologies like PGT is shaped by systemic inequities and what it will take to expand access

- ​What it means to treat parenthood as civic infrastructure, and how that shifts our approach to healthcare, education, and tech

- ​Building trusted, flexible childcare solutions for modern families and what it means to redesign early education from the ground up


​Whether you’re a future parent, a policymaker, an investor, or someone questioning how AI fits into the story of your life—this is the conversation for you.

San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

speaker_insight:
**
Kay Waud, MD, FAADCOG, is a reproductive endocrinologist at HRC Fertility. She is board-certified in both Obstetrics and Gynecology and Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility. Dr. Waud received her medical degree from the University of Illinois at Chicago. She completed her residency in Obstetrics and Gynecology at the University of California, Irvine, and her fellowship in Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility at the University of Southern California. Her areas of expertise include in vitro fertilization (IVF), fertility preservation, and recurrent pregnancy loss.

speaker_insight:
**
Christina Ren is a licensed and board-certified genetic counselor. She earned her Master of Science degree in Genetic Counseling from the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. Her professional experience includes working in various clinical settings, providing genetic counseling services to individuals and families regarding inherited conditions and cancer risk. She's focused on helping patients understand genetic information and make informed decisions about their health. She has experience at Myriad Women's Health.

# What Matters In the Age of AI: Parenthood & Policy

Hosted by HRC Fertility & 5 others

May

27

Tuesday, May 27

7:00 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

[643 Mission St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=643%20Mission%20St&query_place_id=ChIJjb7fUX2AhYARmixpoL4_EFE)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​ **[Hosted by HRC Fertility](https://www.havingbabies.com/locations/san-francisco/)**

​As conversations about fertility, AI, and education move from the clinic to Congress—and from the coasts into cultural mainstream—a new generation is asking: W _hat kind of future are we building, and for whom?_

​This panel brings together leaders from healthcare, tech, and education to explore how innovation is reshaping the landscape for parenthood.

​🎙 Featuring:

​ [Kay Waud](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kay-waud-85483b59/), MD, PhD, HRC Fertility Reproductive endocrinologist at HRC Fertility with an engineering background, focused on expanding access and education on fertility care

​ [Christina Ren](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinaren1/), MS, CGC Genetic counselor specializing in translating complex genomic data and leading initiatives to make PGT testing more accessible

​ [Jasmine Su](https://x.com/jasminewsun) [n](https://jasmi.news/) is a writer and technologist exploring the cultural and political impact of disruptive technologies in the age of AGI and Silicon Valley

[Saachi Dhingra](https://www.linkedin.com/in/saachidhingra/) is the founder of [Sachi](https://gosachi.com/), a VC-backed startup connecting families with licensed PreK–12 educators for flexible, specialized childcare and learning. She’s spent over a decade bridging gaps between families and early education systems.

Moderated by [Livia Han](https://www.linkedin.com/in/livia-han-842802137/), a women's health advocate

* * *

## ​ **Discussion Topics Will Include**

- ​Breakthroughs in fertility care, including AI-guided diagnostics and next-gen embryo selection tools

- ​How access to technologies like PGT is shaped by systemic inequities and what it will take to expand access

- ​What it means to treat parenthood as civic infrastructure, and how that shifts our approach to healthcare, education, and tech

- ​Building trusted, flexible childcare solutions for modern families and what it means to redesign early education from the ground up


​Whether you’re a future parent, a policymaker, an investor, or someone questioning how AI fits into the story of your life—this is the conversation for you.

Location

San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

# “Too Much” Brunch \| Curated Connection + Bold Leadership Activation

Hosted by Well Connected Women

Jun

14

Saturday, June 14

11:00 AM - 2:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

Oakland, California

Welcome! Please choose your desired ticket type:

Get Ticket

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​ _Connecting powerful women who’ve outgrown surface-level spaces._

​ **A space that recognizes that “Too Much” isn’t a Liability. It’s Your Leverage.**

​Normal is canceled.

​People pleasing never built an empire.

​At Too Much Brunch, your loud, brilliant, ambitious self is the **entry ticket**—not something to tone down.

​This is a room for women who are ready for a mojo-activating experience —and are ready to channel it into aligned leadership, elevated visibility, and real relationships.

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=1846/editor-images/n5/7b465f49-8363-4a6b-a162-619229d52c1b.png)

# ​ **What You’ll Walk Away With:**

​This isn’t just breakfast and chit-chat. You’ll leave with:

- ​ **Curated matchmaking**: No random convos—get paired with aligned women based on your goals and interests.

- ​ **Powerhouse networking** with founders, execs, creatives, and thought leaders

- ​A **signature “Too Much” activation workshop** with Sara Anderson

- ​ **Professional photos** that capture your power in the room

- ​ **A network you want to follow up with**, not just a list of LinkedIns

- ​The momentum, clarity, and _audacity_ to make your next big move


![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=531.8632855567806/editor-images/up/a269c8cf-2f1f-488a-bba7-662329e764ba.png)

# ​ **The Flow:**

​ **11:00 AM** — Arrivals + bold first impressions

​ **11:30 AM** — “Too Much” Workshop + Group Activation

​ **11:55 AM** — Delicious Seated Mexican family-style brunch

​ **1:30 PM** — Magic Matchmaking, Power conversation circles + iconic photo moments

​ **2:00 PM** — Afterglow mingling, integration, and intention-setting

# ​This isn’t your average coffee-and-small-talk.  Our brunches are bold, electric, unforgettable.

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=406.62983425414365/editor-images/id/b810ca27-99ca-4ec0-bd2d-988bcdb06e2d.png)

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=193.33333333333331/editor-images/ms/4a613796-1354-41fb-8bde-50b658d41a5f.png)

# ​ **This Is For You If…**

- ​You’re a woman leader, founder, or change-maker craving real community

- ​You’re done with boring “networking” and want resonance, not business cards

- ​You want to be surrounded by women who are _going for it_—in career, creativity, and purpose

- ​You’ve outgrown playing small—and you're ready for a room that reflects your next level


​ **Your ticket includes:**

- ​Access to the exclusive Too Much Brunch experience

- ​Delicious brunch and beverages

- ​Signature "Too Much" coaching + activation led by Sara Anderson

- ​Curated AI magic matchmaking with your "must know" connections.

- ​Professional photo moments (because icons deserve to be captured)

- ​Electric energy, new friends, real momentum


​ **ICONIC Upgrade:**

- ​ **Private VIP Coaching Integration Circle:** Take this experience and run with it. Join a curated micro-room of women going _all in_ on their next level.

- ​ **Private Group Chat:** for high-frequency, high-impact connection post-event.


## ​Location: Oakland, California

* * *

​ **This Isn’t Just Brunch. It’s a Power Portal.**

​Let’s be real—you’ve got enough half-hearted panels and awkward mixers on your calendar.

​ **This is different.**

​ **This is bold. Electric. Curated. Transformational.Important: This event will sell out, and when it's full, it's full. Grab your seat now as an insurance policy on your bold next level.**

**About Your Host:**

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=605.4992764109985/editor-images/ls/737a3a32-00ee-496e-b8b4-bc00869c260f.png)

​

Sara Anderson is the go-to coach for powerhouse women leaders ready to be seen, heard, and felt at their full magnitude.

As the founder of Lead Out Loud, Sara has coached executives, founders, and industry leaders to build magnetic presence, command rooms, and lead audaciously—without shrinking, shape-shifting, or selling out.

​Her signature approach combines real-world leadership strategy with profound nervous system wisdom, making expansion not just possible, but inevitable.

Sara’s work is where bold ambition meets embodied power—and Too Much isn’t just welcomed. It’s required.

# SF: Take2 x OOI Speed Dating

[Take2](https://lu.ma/taketwo?k=c)

Jun

8

Sunday, June 8

1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDT

[550 Laguna St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=550%20Laguna%20St&query_place_id=ChIJQ9xlT6KAhYAReQIfVQZP4ds)

Sold Out

This event is sold out and no longer taking registrations.

About Event

​​ **_⭐️ We're bringing Take2 to SF in collaboration with_** **_[Odd One In](https://www.instagram.com/playoddonein/)_** **_⭐️_**

​Take2 is for intentional and open minded daters. Instead of swiping, sending "vibe check" messages or feeling pressured to plan an incredible first date... come to Take2!

​​Here's how it will work:

* * *

​​​📍The Meet & Greet (June 8 @ 1-4 PM)

​​​Start by filling out a quick values-based form. (This will help us for the 1 - 1 round on Tuesday)

​Join us for coffee and matcha on Sunday! ⭐️

​All 40 singles will move around the room in groups with curated questions and activities.

​​​At the end of the event, you’ll leave with a short list of your top 8 picks.

* * *

​​​💌 Curated 1-1 Speed dates (June 10 @ 6:30PM )

​Meet the same group again on Tuesday night for a round of speed dates and a group mixer.

​We will put together 4 speed dates for 15 minutes each with your most compatible matches. Catch up over wine and tapas before enjoying your final group mixer.

​Submit your Top 5 picks from the end of the night.

* * *

​​​📫 Check your inbox! (June 13)

​​​By June 13, you'll receive an email with your match and a method to exchange contact information - should you choose to follow up with a date.

* * *

​​​💬 Why Take2 is different:

- ​​​ **Real matchmaking** — no algorithms, no endless chats. Just thoughtful pairings from someone who’s paying attention.

- ​​​ **Effortless** — your first 2 meet cutes are all planned. Just show up!

- ​​​ **Affordable** — all the intention of high-end matchmaking, at a fraction of the price.

- ​​​ **Safe & clear intentions** — everyone at this event is single, genuinely interested, and open to being matched in the same way. You won’t have to wonder if someone’s serious, available, or just here for fun. The guessing game is over.


* * *

​​​🎟 Your ticket includes access to both events + matchmaking. A beverage is included on date 1 and wine & tapas on date 2.

​​​📸 Heads up: We may take photos or videos during the event.

✅ Please only sign up if you can attend _both_ June 8 and June 10.

​​​🔨 While there isn't an explicit age restriction, our past events have typically served between the ages 23-31. We will monitor applicants to be within that age range!

Location

550 Laguna St

San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

\\

# SF: Take2 x OOI Speed Dating

[Take2](https://lu.ma/taketwo?k=c)

Jun

8

Sunday, June 8

1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDT

[550 Laguna St\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=550%20Laguna%20St&query_place_id=ChIJQ9xlT6KAhYAReQIfVQZP4ds)

Sold Out

This event is sold out and no longer taking registrations.

About Event

​​ **_⭐️ We're bringing Take2 to SF in collaboration with_** **_[Odd One In](https://www.instagram.com/playoddonein/)_** **_⭐️_**

​Take2 is for intentional and open minded daters. Instead of swiping, sending "vibe check" messages or feeling pressured to plan an incredible first date... come to Take2!

​​Here's how it will work:

* * *

​​​📍The Meet & Greet (June 8 @ 1-4 PM)

​​​Start by filling out a quick values-based form. (This will help us for the 1 - 1 round on Tuesday)

​Join us for coffee and matcha on Sunday! ⭐️

​All 40 singles will move around the room in groups with curated questions and activities.

​​​At the end of the event, you’ll leave with a short list of your top 8 picks.

* * *

​​​💌 Curated 1-1 Speed dates (June 10 @ 6:30PM )

​Meet the same group again on Tuesday night for a round of speed dates and a group mixer.

​We will put together 4 speed dates for 15 minutes each with your most compatible matches. Catch up over wine and tapas before enjoying your final group mixer.

​Submit your Top 5 picks from the end of the night.

* * *

​​​📫 Check your inbox! (June 13)

​​​By June 13, you'll receive an email with your match and a method to exchange contact information - should you choose to follow up with a date.

* * *

​​​💬 Why Take2 is different:

- ​​​ **Real matchmaking** — no algorithms, no endless chats. Just thoughtful pairings from someone who’s paying attention.

- ​​​ **Effortless** — your first 2 meet cutes are all planned. Just show up!

- ​​​ **Affordable** — all the intention of high-end matchmaking, at a fraction of the price.

- ​​​ **Safe & clear intentions** — everyone at this event is single, genuinely interested, and open to being matched in the same way. You won’t have to wonder if someone’s serious, available, or just here for fun. The guessing game is over.


* * *

​​​🎟 Your ticket includes access to both events + matchmaking. A beverage is included on date 1 and wine & tapas on date 2.

​​​📸 Heads up: We may take photos or videos during the event.

✅ Please only sign up if you can attend _both_ June 8 and June 10.

​​​🔨 While there isn't an explicit age restriction, our past events have typically served between the ages 23-31. We will monitor applicants to be within that age range!

Location

550 Laguna St

San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

# Sales for Founders: No Bullshit Talk on Building a Sales Team

Hosted by Awesomic Founders Social Club, Stacy Pavlyshyna & Roman Sevast

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

6:00 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​So you’ve closed your first customers yourself, maybe hired a couple of folks to help — and then you need to turn that into a scalable sales machine.

​ **How to scale results, not sales mess?** For this, Awesomic is bringing the top practitioners to you to answer off the record the most burning questions:

- ​How to know when you’re ready to scale?

- ​What are the most expensive mistakes, and how to not make them?

- ​How to generate more sales without increasing costs and complexity?

- ​How to structure the team right?

- ​... your own question?


​Our host is **Mike Weber,** VP of Sales at Awesomic — known as sales powerhouse from companies like Quancast, Intercom and Carta. He has led Quancast from $0 to $400M in revenue and helped Intercom to grow outbound sales from 2% to 40% of revenue. Mike knows it all: from early stage fires to being a key sales contributor at Series D stage.

​His speaker for fireside chat is **Chris Martellotti**, a seasoned seller and founder with 2 decades of experience of building revenue, teams and companies. His career includes building Enterprise Sales department at Dolby, business development leadership at Quancast and AdBrite, and successfully launching own AI-powered startup The Lyceum.

​Awesomic waits for you in San Francisco’s downtown with tasty snacks, non-alcoholic drinks and a company of bright builders around.

​RSVP, please, and make sure you got a confirmation to attend.

​The cost is zero, and the upside of the insights can bring you **millions in revenue**.

# SaaS Lander 2025: A Tech Night in the City

Hosted by Louis Munos, Clovis Singer Business France & Louis Munos

May

22

Thursday, May 22

5:30 PM - 9:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

San Francisco, California

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​Join us for **SaaS Lander Tech Night**, an inspiring evening where innovation, entrepreneurship and networking converge in the heart of San Francisco.

​Immerse yourself in the vibrant world of tech on **May 22nd**, from **5:30pm to 9:00pm**, at the iconic **GenAI Loft AWS**.

​Business France is pleased to invite you to meet the **thirteen companies** selected from the 2025 cohort.

​ **Agenda:**

- ​Introduction by Business France and AWS

- ​Pitch competition between our 13 resident CEOs ​

- ​A prestigious jury made of Foundry ML, AWS, MenloVentures & FrenchFounders

- ​Cocktail & Networking


​ **What's SaaS Lander?** It's the **acceleration program** powered by Business France that empowers the founders of strongly differentiated **B2B SaaS businesses to scale in the US**.

​​For more information about SaaS Lander:  [https://saas-lander.com/](https://saas-lander.com/)

​Whether you're scaling your startup, seeking investment opportunities, or exploring strategic collaborations, this event offers exclusive insights, valuable connections, and an immersion into the Silicon Valley tech ecosystem.

​ **Partners**

​Thank you to all our precious partners for helping us shape SaaS Lander: [Tarter Krinsky](https://www.tarterkrinsky.com/), [Foundry](https://mlfoundry.com/), [Frenchfounders](https://www.frenchfounders.com/home), [Gide](https://www.gide.com/) & [Amazon Web Services](https://aws.amazon.com/).

​ **Photography and Filming**

​​Please note: This event will be photographed and filmed. Business France reserves the right to use photographs and video from the event for marketing and communications purposes. By attending the event, you consent to the use of your image for these purposes.

​ **Safety**

​​Business France's events include every gender, sexuality, race, and ability. Any form of discrimination will not be tolerated. For security issues, please get in touch with the venue.

# \[SF\] AI After Hours @ GitHub w/ Encord

[Artificially Intelligent](https://lu.ma/artificially-intelligent?k=c)

May

22

Thursday, May 22

5:30 PM - 8:30 PM PDT

[GitHub\\
\\
San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=GitHub&query_place_id=ChIJ32KaYX-AhYARNa93OffiHEk)

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Register

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​​Join us at GitHub HQ - connect with fellow AI enthusiasts, learn from industry experts, & enjoy a slice of pizza 🍕 ( [Here](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7302440504447623168) is a recap of the last event!)

* * *

## ​ **Agenda**

​5:30pm: Doors open

6pm - 8:00pm: Lightning talks ⚡

8:00pm - 8:30pm: Networking

* * *

## ​ **Talks**

​ **Talk 1:** How do we create the “ChatGPT moment” for 3D understanding?

**Speaker**: Zach Sussman (Co-Founder & CTO @ Mach9)

**Abstract**: Twenty years ago, understanding and extracting meaning from unstructured text was an open research question; now it’s solvable with an API call to a large language model. Drawing parallels to modern LLMs, we’ll explore how making breakthroughs in 3D perception depends on having large-scale, high-fidelity datasets like those that Mach9 is uniquely positioned to provide.

​ **Talk 2:** Transforming the safety industry using computer vision

**Speaker**: Abhishek Venkataraman (Director of Perception @ Voxel) & Brandon Loyd (VP of Product @ Voxel)

**Abstract**: Voxel’s computer‑vision platform transforms existing camera networks into a real‑time safety intelligence layer, flagging hazards before they escalate and dramatically reducing incident rates across warehouses, retail distribution centers, and manufacturing plants. In this talk, Abhishek and Brandon will unpack how Voxel AI is deploying its edge‑to‑cloud ML pipeline on thousands of camera to deliver rapid ROI and safer workplaces for Fortune 1000 customers.

* * *

## ​ **H** osts

​ **Encord** is a multimodal data platform for AI. With Encord, AI teams can easily manage, curate, and label petabytes of images, videos, audio, documents, text, and DICOM files on one unified platform while benefiting from AI-assisted speed and accuracy with human-in-the-loop workflows.

​ 🤔 Learn more [here](https://encord.com/)

🤳 Follow Encord on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/encord-team/)

​​ 📈 We’re hiring! [Join our team](https://encord.com/careers/)

![User Uploaded Image](https://images.lumacdn.com/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto,fit=cover,dpr=2,quality=75,width=800,height=160.31589338598224/editor-images/1f/27487678-7303-43d6-b779-e783553c8e6a)

​

​ **GitHub** is proud to support AI After Hours. GitHub believes in the power of local communities and is committed to enabling the next generation of developers. Whether you’re building in open source or teaching yourself how to code, with GitHub Copilot's free plan and Agent Mode, GitHub is making AI coding assistance more accessible than ever. Thank you to GitHub for supporting our community and continuing to center developer happiness.

speaker_insight:
**
Zach Sussman is the Co-Founder and CTO of Mach9, a company focused on AI-powered software development. Prior to Mach9, he was a founding member and CTO at Nomic AI. He has a background in machine learning and software engineering. Zach is passionate about making AI tools more accessible and user-friendly for developers. His expertise lies in building and scaling AI-driven platforms.

speaker_insight: Abhishek Venkataraman is the Director of Perception at Voxel, a company focused on AI-powered safety in the workplace. **Abstract**: Voxel’s computer‑vision platform transforms existing camera networks into a real‑time safety intelligence layer, flagging hazards before they escalate and dramatically reducing incident rates across warehouses, retail distribution centers, and manufacturing plants. In this talk, Abhishek and Brandon will unpack how Voxel AI is deploying its edge‑to‑cloud ML pipeline on thousands of camera to deliver rapid ROI and safer workplaces for Fortune 1000 customers.

* * *

## ​ **H** osts

​ **Encord** is a multimodal data platform for AI. With Encord, AI teams can easily manage, curate, and label petabytes of images, videos, audio, documents, text, and DICOM files on one unified platform while benefiting from AI-assisted speed and accuracy with human-in-the-loop workflows.

​ 🤔 Learn more [here](https://encord.com/)

🤳 Follow Encord on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/encord-team/)

​​ 📈 We’re hiring! [Join our team](https://encord.com/careers/)

​ **GitHub** is proud to support AI After Hours. GitHub believes in the power of local communities and is committed to enabling the next generation of developers. About Event

​ **Interesting times we live in, right?**

​Founders are navigating volatile markets, shifting investor expectations, and a wave of AI and economic unknowns.

​Join us on **May 20th** as leaders from **[Vanta](https://www.vanta.com/)**, **[Puzzle](https://puzzle.io/)**, and **[Vouch](https://www.vouch.us/)** explore how to keep your team focused, communicate clearly with customers, and invest in the right foundations from the start—so you can grow with confidence.

​ **Agenda**

​5:30 PM – Registration & Networking

6:00 – 6:45 PM – Panel Discussion

– [Sasha Orloff](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sashaorloff/), Co-Founder & CEO at Puzzle, previously Co-Founder & CEO at LendUp (W12)

– [Travis Hedge](https://www.linkedin.com/in/travishedge/), Co-Founder & CRO at Vouch Insurance (YC S19)

– [Sarah Scharf](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarah-scharf-55339a31/), VP of Marketing at Vanta (YC W18)

​6:45 – 7:00 PM – Q&A

7:00 – 8:30 PM – Networking, Snacks & Drinks

​Bring your curiosity, get your questions ready, and get excited for the night!

**About** **[Puzzle](https://puzzle.io/)** **🧩🚀**

​​​Puzzle’s **accounting software** is built for **growing startups** that need real-time financial insights without the hassles of monthly bookkeeping. Its **AI-powered platform** automates transaction categorization, reconciliation, and daily reporting for accurate numbers you can trust. The result is faster decisions, stronger growth, and peace of mind.

​ **About** **[Vouch](http://vouch.us/)**

​​Vouch is the leader in **business insurance for venture-backed startups**. With deep expertise in tech, Vouch delivers precise coverage as startups scale from launch to IPO. Vouch makes it easy to master insurance with a modern digital platform, 10 exclusive coverages for tech, and a curated marketplace of tech-focused carriers.

**About** **[Vanta](https://www.vanta.com/)**

​Vanta's trust management platform takes the manual work out of your security and compliance process and replaces it with continuous automation—whether you’re pursuing your first framework or managing a complex program.

About Event

​ **🚀 VIP 1900 Broadway Launch & Lunch Event – June 9 \| 12–2PM**

​You're invited to an exclusive **VIP 1900 Broadway Launch & Lunch Event** as we unveil the future of innovation in the East Bay.

​We’re activating **1900 Broadway in Oakland** as the anchor point of the Bay Area’s emerging **Tech Triangle**—and this is your front-row seat. This launch kicks off our ecosystem engagement series, bringing together **top innovators, investors, and influencers** across tech, venture, and media to shape what’s next.

​🌟 **What to Expect:**

— Curated networking with leading founders, funders & ecosystem builders

— A first look at our strategic vision for 1900 Broadway

— Free, secured parking (see below)

— A high-impact, relaxed lunch with the right people in the room

​📍 **Location:**

1900 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94612

(Secured parking available at the Franklin Street garage behind the building)

​🅿️ **Driving Instructions:**

Set your GPS to: **Coco Cafe, 1924 Franklin St., Oakland, CA 94612**

Park in the secured garage across from Coco Cafe. **Franklin is a one-way—stay left** as you turn. Don’t pass the **skywalk**—that’s your landmark.

​🚇 **Taking BART?**

Exit at **19th St/Oakland**—the building is directly outside the station.

​🎟️ **Seats are limited—RSVP now to secure your spot.**

For questions or day-of needs, text me directly: **408-992-5043**

​Let’s spark the next wave of innovation—right here in Oakland.

event_summary: Bringing together 50+ AI Founders, Investors, and Leaders for a night of socializing and ideas. Enjoy complimentary food and beverage as we connect. speaker_details: At DTC, Elana invests in early-stage technology companies in AI, enterprise software, and deep tech. She is driven by curiosity, and drawn to original thinkers with a pragmatic approach. Entrepreneurship is defined by not only the journey of category creation, but also the struggles and challenges along the way. Elana aspires to be the investor that her CEO would text first to tell her the good, the bad, and the ugly. At DTC, Elana is thrilled to work with some of the brightest minds and innovative startups in the tech industry. She deeply appreciates DTC’s strong culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Before joining DTC, Elana spent more than a decade at Intel Capital, where she led investments in AI, Frontier Tech, IoT, and robotics. Notable exits include Pixeom (acquired by Siemens), Rubikloud (acquired by Kinaxis), and Venafi (acquired by Thomas Bravos). Before Intel, she cofounded two startups and coupled those ventures with operational experiences spanning engineering, product development, and business development disciplines at software, cloud computing, and semiconductor companies. Elana holds an MBA from Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management, Master of Electrical Engineering from Tufts University, and a Bachelor of Engineering Science from University of Toronto. She is also a Kauffman Fellow Class ’22.

# Silicon Valley AI Startups Night. Speaker: Elana Lian, Partner, Dell Technologies Capital

[Tech + Startups Community](https://lu.ma/calendar/cal-YcDhGAF57tfzJ0e)

May

21

Wednesday, May 21

6:00 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

Register to See Address

Palo Alto, California

Approval Required

Your registration is subject to approval by the host.

Welcome! To join the event, please register below.

Request to Join

You will be asked to verify token ownership with your wallet.

About Event

​The [Tech + Startups Community](https://www.techandstartups.com/) & [Springcamp](http://springcamp.co/), an Early Stage VC backing exceptional founders from day one, have teamed up for a special night in Downtown Palo Alto.

​Bringing together 50+ AI Founders, Investors, and Leaders for a night of socializing and ideas. Enjoy complimentary food and beverage as we connect.

​The evening includes a Fireside Chat with [Elana Lian, Partner, Dell Technologies Capital](https://www.delltechnologiescapital.com/team/elana-lian), who will share the fund's perspective on AI Startups and other key topics.

## ​ **​As space is limited, please request to join.**

## ​​Event Agenda:

​​6:00pm - 7:00pm Check-in + Socializing

​​7:00pm - 7:30pm Fireside Chat + Q&A with Elana Lian, Partner, Dell Technologies Capital

​​7:30pm - 8:00pm More Socializing

​The fireside chat will be moderated by [Denis Hiller](https://www.linkedin.com/in/denishiller/), Founder & CEO, Tech + Startups Community.

## ​ **Some background on** Elana Lian **:**

​At DTC, Elana invests in early-stage technology companies in AI, enterprise software, and deep tech. She is driven by curiosity, and drawn to original thinkers with a pragmatic approach. Entrepreneurship is defined by not only the journey of category creation, but also the struggles and challenges along the way. Elana aspires to be the investor that her CEO would text first to tell her the good, the bad, and the ugly.

​At DTC, Elana is thrilled to work with some of the brightest minds and innovative startups in the tech industry. She deeply appreciates DTC’s strong culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

​Before joining DTC, Elana spent more than a decade at Intel Capital, where she led investments in AI, Frontier Tech, IoT, and robotics. Notable exits include Pixeom (acquired by Siemens), Rubikloud (acquired by Kinaxis), and Venafi (acquired by Thomas Bravos). Before Intel, she cofounded two startups and coupled those ventures with operational experiences spanning engineering, product development, and business development disciplines at software, cloud computing, and semiconductor companies.

​Elana holds an MBA from Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management, Master of Electrical Engineering from Tufts University, and a Bachelor of Engineering Science from University of Toronto. She is also a Kauffman Fellow Class ’22.

## ​About [Springcamp](https://www.springcamp.co/):

​We believe that the core of early-stage investing is being the first to find extraordinary founders and then to relentlessly support them in their pursuit of big dreams.

​With this vision, we are proud to have shared the journey with many startups in our portfolio who have become leaders in their respective industries. When we believe and invest in a startup, we become not just their investor, but we see our role often take shape as a friend, sometimes as a family, or even at times simply as a fan.

​We aim to be a reliable partner by creating an ecosystem that enables our startups to spring up and flourish together.

## ​About [Tech + Startups Community](https://www.techandstartups.com/):

​​​​Launched in 2023, we are a community of 10,000+ Startup Founders, Investors and Tech Leaders. We are active in Silicon Valley, New York, Miami, Boston, Atlanta, London, Santa Monica, Dubai, Bogota, Washington DC, Orlando, Boston, Chicago, Atlanta, Raleigh, and beyond.

​ **Learn more about our upcoming Conference:** the [Silicon Valley Startup Ecosystem Conference 2026](https://lu.ma/vggko9pe) at Foothill College's Smithwick Theatre.

​Here is a recent photo from our Startup Ecosystem Conference at Miami Dade College Auditorium:

speaker_insight: Elana Lian is a Partner at Dell Technologies Capital, focusing on investments in enterprise software and infrastructure. Before joining Dell Technologies Capital, she was at Intel Capital. She holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a Bachelor of Science degree from MIT in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering. Her investment interests include areas like cloud, AI, security, and data management. She has experience working directly with founders and advising portfolio companies on various strategic initiatives.

[San Francisco UXD](https://lu.ma/SFUXD?k=c)

May

22

Thursday, May 22

6:00 PM - 8:00 PM PDT

[Southern Pacific Brewing\\

San Francisco, California](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Southern%20Pacific%20Brewing&query_place_id=ChIJn5G9Fzp-j4ARRs66QTw4XAY)

Register

About Event

# ​ **🍸 Design social hour: Post config edition**

​Remember all those inspiring conversations at Config? Let's keep the connections going! After a couple of weeks to catch your breath, join us for a design social hour. Let's reconnect, share our favorite takeaways from the conference, and keep the design conversations flowing over drinks and good company.

## ​ **​​❓What to expect**

- ​​Join our private WhatsApp community (if you haven't already!)

- ​​Donate to enter a raffle

- ​​Make new connections and friends


## ​ **​​🧑‍🎨 Who should come**

​​​Anyone interested in design!

​​​If you're a product designer, graphic designer, brand designer, industrial designer, service designer, fashion designer, content designer, or just anyone interested in the impact of human-centered design, come hang out.

If you're a marketer, engineer, data analyst, or product manager, come chat and make connections.

* * *

# ​ **​​About San Francisco UXD**

​​​​​We're a not-for-profit focused on building an inclusive design community and encouraging design thinking for all.

​​ **[Connect with us on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/san-francisco-uxd/)**

**[See our other events](https://lu.ma/SFUXD)**

​​By registering for this event, you agree to our [code of conduct](https://www.notion.so/Community-code-of-conduct-1c9614e832c0801ea054ea932ec82e3c?pvs=4).
